Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Amy S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed for three nights at the hotel, and had a very nice time. The hotel staff was VERY pleasant and accommodating and I enjoyed my interactions with them. The historic building is beautiful, the decorations tasteful, the room was roomy and enjoyable. One of the best features was the free breakfast buffet that had on it anything that you could possibly want (meat, eggs, cereal, fruit, bread, etc.) The staff who worked the breakfast were very kind and very thorough. The negatives? Location. I know that others claim that this is a good area, and maybe it is, but I found the area to be sketchy and did not feel comfortable walking down to the Inner Harbor because of the nearby neighborhoods. This, of course, is not the hotel's fault and there is plenty of parking garages and public transportation to accommodate for this anyhow. Another negative- we got stuck in the elevator not one, but two times. Both times the issue was fixed and we were out of the elevator within 15-20 minutes, but still. Scary. Lastly, we found a package of condoms behind the nightstand in our room. I know this is small, but it made me wonder how clean the room actually is. Thank God the condoms were in foil, not used. Regardless, I want to reiterate how kind the staff was, and how beautiful the building was. I would recommend this place to friends- for the price, you cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: cakebaker31
Reviews.Content: My 2 daughters and I spent 5 days in Baltimore for spring break. We were looking for a hotel that was central to Inner Harbor, museums, shopping, and Washington DC. I booked 5 nights thru booking.com for approx $350 total. We checked in on Sunday, staff was very friendly. We entered the room that we were given, it was very small, dark and had a view of a brick wall. We immediately called the front desk and received a new room, which was much larger, brighter and had a much better view. A hot breakfast was included, each morning. The hot, home cooked breakfast was very good and featured slightly different offerings, each morning. There was also yogurt, breakfast pastries, cold cereal, variety of juices, etc. The heat/air is a bit antiquated and therefore controlled from a central source. The parking area is located beneath the hotel and is secure and well lit, but very small, awkward and the parking spaces are very, very tight. The hotel is definitely in need of a refresh, but overall was clean and definitely a good value. Pros...price, hot breakfast, convenient location. Cons.....aesthetics, parking, heating/air conditioning. Tips - get to breakfast early, tends to get a bit chaotic, later in the morning. Also if you opt to park beneath the building ($15 per day), plan to arrive back to the garage by at least 8:00,so that you can have your choice of spaces, Lastly we walked one block over to catch the Charm City Circulator (free), which transported us to Penn Station so that we could catch the train to DC and then we used the Circulator the following day to go to the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid8
Reviews.Content: On our return from a golf excursion to South Carolina, we stopped in Baltimore to attend an Orioles/Yankees game at Camden Yards. MVH is well located - 15 minute walk to CY and good public transportation options. The price is remarkable for an inner city hotel of this quality; the breakfast included in the rate was an excellent buffet in an appealing room. The $15 charge for parking in a garage under the hotel is also remarkable. We will return for a Red Sox game.

Reviews.Title: “Warm sleeping, ok breakfast, terrible parking”
Reviews.Author: Brittanythechef
Reviews.Content: The parking lot is under the hotel, locked garage which was nice but if you have a large vehicle it will be impossible to park. The parking is so tight! We were told by the website and front staff how wonderful the breakfast was and how big of a selection but when we ate we had eggs, sausage only (no bacon), cereal, bread...that's all but no ketchup! It was ok. Yes better then other hotels but not as much of a selection like we were told. We went in April and there is no AC!! When the hotel switches over from heat to AC it's warm in the rooms so our sleeping arrangements weren't the best. The room was clean. Beds weren't that comfortable. Location to the inner harbor was good

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,Great People. Awful parking situation!”
Reviews.Author: Pololady1056
Reviews.Content: Motel has had a good renevation! Parking is a serious problem! Breakfast was good!

Reviews.Title: “Large room, Extra Large Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kevinmpa
Reviews.Content: Our room was a big as a suite and it cost about $80 with AAA. The beds were comfortable. Parking added $15 (overnight with in and out privileges) but it was a secure indoor lot, and parking in Baltimore can cost $5 an hour. They let us park in the lot even though we arrived before check-in time. We walked to the Inner Harbor, about 8 blocks. There were a number of homeless people along the route, so we stayed on main streets. There were also a lot of drunks of all sorts on the street, but it was St. Patrick's Day, so it may be a more relaxing walk on another evening. This is not the most convenient hotel if you want to spend the night wandering the Inner Harbor area. The main purpose of our stay was to attend a lecture at the Walters Art Museum, and the Mount Vernon is just around the corner, so it was perfect for our needs. It is also very close to the Peabody Conservatory's concert halls. We ate a nice dinner at Turkish restaurant near the hotel called the Cazbah. In the morning the hotel served a complimentary breakfast that was truly a full meal, with choice of eggs, potatoes, bacon, even grits which I like on occasion. There was yogurt, fresh fruit, cereal, bagels, and a decent dark roast coffee. There was decaf tea, which is my wife's drink of choice. The variety and size of the breakfast makes the Mt. Vernon a very good deal for families with children. There is a old grand piano in the lobby and some young girls proved that they had studied music, by playing a bit. The hotel isn't luxurious by any means, but it has character. It offers good value, and we would stay there again. I somehow left my camera at the front desk when I checked in, and when we arrived at the room, the phone was ringing to let me know. That saved my weekend and made me a fan of the Mount Vernon.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: KeithB05
Reviews.Content: I don’t understand some of the other reviews. This hotel is a third of the price of a Marriott or Hilton. Yet many of the other reviewers expect it to be the same quality. Sorry, folks, but that just can’t happen. This place is very reasonably priced and it can be that way because it doesn’t have fancy facilities and the rooms are basic. The location is very good and within just a couple of blocks of the art museum, basilica, and Washington Monument. Other reviewers say that it is in a bad neighborhood. That is just nuts. The area is a downtown area but there are nice cafes and antique shops within a block. Yes, there are some homeless people around, but that is the same all over downtown Baltimore (and most other urban centers). The rooms are basic but spacious and have the feel of a lower-priced hotel at a highway exit. Nevertheless, the are clean and have all the basic features needed. I found it to be quiet and comfortable. A nice, hot breakfast is included and it is quite tasty. The staff members were all pleasant. For this price, how can anyone complain? And if you do, then go stay at the Hilton and pay a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Conflicted”
Reviews.Author: NJSKIM247
Reviews.Content: This was a place that could have received an excellent rating, if not for the unprofessional, 'it is was it is, your problem not mine' night manager and the 'I can't do anything to help you, oh well, thanks for paying upfront' day manager. I sponsored a trip for an international non-profit organization which provides outreach young girls. 16 young girls and adults were taken to Baltimore this past weekend. I purchased 5 rooms at a great price for 2 nights. Unfortunately, after experiencing a severe allergy attack from all the pollen outside, I was looking forward to seeking refuge in an air-conditioned room. Well, that wasn't happening since I realized that the a/c was not functioning in the hotel. Yes, this was a major problem for me, the adult with severe hot flashes, and the children who had breathing issues. The terribly arrogant night manager just shrugged his shoulders. He said 'we ran out of fans and this was unexpected.' Then, informed me of the future plans of converting the system which doesn't go on until April and how old the building was, etc. How is this unexpected when you gave a bunch of fans to other people who only purchased one room. He was not about to do a thing to help us to prevent having to send me to the er or any of the other children I was responsible for to the hospital because the heat in the rooms was rising. Since he, did and said all he was going to say, he looked past me and ask if he could help the next person. If I could have afforded it, I would have tried to have booked another hotel, but that was impossible to do with all the kids at 10pm. It would have been nice to be told about this prior to checking in. Luckily, the Friday night security guard became someone who was the most helpful to me. So, the only resolution was for me to find a store open at 11pm and purchase fans. So, the guard, and only her, told me that there was a 24 hour Walmart near by and how to get there. She was the only one trying to resolve the immediate issue. I purchased f box fans for $125.51 with money designated for the activities on our trip. We survived the night. And, had to drop one of our activities from the itinerary. Not something you want to do with kids looking forward to going places. The next day, I had the displeasure of speaking to the unhelpful day manager. I thought that I could be reimbursed for the fans, especially since they have, and periodically need fans, and have, and use fans for when the weather is 'unexpected.' Or some other compensation. Foolish me. I was told that the night manager should have made other accommodations for us. And, that no money could be refunded because I prepaid for the rooms. So, sorry so sad, next attitude is unacceptable. Oh yeah, after I checked out and left the rooms, I told him that I didn't want to be charged for the bottle that was never there in one of the rooms. I was told that the $2 bottles of water would not be charged to me because it was so hot in the rooms. Didn't open any bottles. Gee, thanks for nothing. I was hoping to post a positive review, because the hotel is priced right, nicely kept, great complimentary breakfast, reasonable parking options, great places in walking distance and the location was perfect. I was hoping to recommend this hotel to others, including our group's national and international sponsors visiting this area. Is this how Marshall Hotels & Resorts, management company runs business. I thought they want more business not discourage future business from people who would purchase more than just one room and for more than one night. But, I have been finding myself starting off with the bad, then some good, then the bad again. It's terrible that things couldn't have been worked out. I felt bad for the other guy who complained about his room being a sweltering 100 degrees. But, at least they asked him if they could make other arrangements for him. Maybe if I paid for 1 room, I would have gotten better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “four stars include price and staff”
Reviews.Author: ivyU_s_a_
Reviews.Content: the average may not convey all that's good about this. the reasonable price would make it a four-star hotel. our room was large, the beds were comfortable, and it was very clean. the staff was perhaps the best thing of all, as they were helpful and accomodating. they include breakfast in the price, altho the hot food was not as good as should be, while the rest were good choices. the location is excellent for downtown (not inner harbor) baltimore, quiet and within easy walking distance to peabody and the walters museum, and easy driving to the harbor area. parking is not free, but a more reasonable rate than most. we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise”
Reviews.Author: JFCSpartaNJ
Reviews.Content: A lot of the reviews I had read were not favorable. Wrong! The hotel is in a great location, there was plenty of free self- parking with in-and-out capability. The room was large - not elegant but large and clean. Service is a little sloppy but the front desk crew was fine and friendly. Breakfast was fair - ok if you eat pre-made stuff like cereal and yogurt. Hot food was not so good. Two minor complaints - I never heard of a hotel that ran out of tissues - no box available for the bathroom. The kitchen ran out of orange and they were out for two breakfasts. If you can't get the fountain oj, go to the supermarket and buy a few half gallons to get you through. I bought two nights with parking and breakfast through Living Social. Really a bargain. I would go back - and bring my own tissues!!

Reviews.Title: “5 Days at Mount Vernon”
Reviews.Author: Mississippigal43
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days and found it met our needs. The room was roomy with a comfortable bed. Bathroom and decor had been recently updated. Is in the middle of a nice old neighborhood with great restaurants and attractions. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Has a delicious breakfast with a variety of items. The only thing missing was a small refrigerator and microwave in our room which we could have one for an extra $10 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for Orioles trip”
Reviews.Author: GoCanucks2233
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a couple buddies on a trip to see the Orioles upset the Redsox in September 2011! It was very clean, largish sized rooms and was about a 15 minute walk to Camden Yards. The front desk people were very friendly. The best part was the unbelievably low price we were charged for a better than decent downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: HappytravellerCork
Reviews.Content: Good american-size room. The room was warm. The heating controls worked. Reasonable choice of TV channels. Breakfast was fair. Very limited choice of food (hot and cold). when things ran out, they were gone. This included knives - when the knives ran out people used spoons and forks to spread butter. I didn't like the hidden charges. Charging extra for the use of the room safe was a sharp practice I thought.

Reviews.Title: “Would not be my pick but great employee's”
Reviews.Author: Tim A
Reviews.Content: I stayed in mid January for 2 nights. Andy at the front desk was fantastic! He was helpful and gave great advise. I took the light rail in from the airport and was a bit concerned at the area of the stop for the hotel, most of the buildings were abandoned and had to walk 3 blocks to the hotel. The city itself is very run down unless you are on certain streets or at the Inner Harbour. The hotel itself is older and could use some refurbishments carpet,furniture and such. Breakfast was okay. All in all I wold not stay here again I would recommend staying in the Inner Harbour area.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: jearly67
Reviews.Content: Not luxury but more than adequate. Central location, attentive staff & full breakfast included. Near museums, dining & the Circulator bus route. Better than budget.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: eshinn
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with the Living Social deal to see the fireworks at the lighting of the Monument and visit the inner harbor. It was a pleasant surprise to see how nice the Mt. Vernon neighborhood was and how close we were to everything. We found the staff of the hotel and also the Baltimore residents we encountered to be very friendly and helpful. In any large city you will find vagrants or those trying to scam you for money. It comes with the territory. We encountered a few, but not near the hotel. The hotel room was more than adequate for the king size bed and the bathroom was spacious. We brought our own pillows after reading another review here. Yes, they do need to be upgraded. We heard no street noise and had no temperature issues as others have mentioned. The garage was a tight fit for our SUV but we managed. It was a great benefit to have the parking available. The breakfast which was included in the price was pretty good... a few mistakes (potatoes were undercooked one day, omelette was botched) but overall not bad at all. All in all the hotel seemed very clean but just two little annoyances I have to mention. A blue M&M remained on the floor of our room the entire 2-day stay. I left it there just to see if housekeeping would pick it up but I guess they didn't see it. The dark color kind of blended in with the carpet. Also, a Q-tip remained on the floor of the hallway near the elevator at the 3rd floor for the entire 2 days we were there. Housekeeping staff had to have noticed it. I was surprised no one bothered to pick it up. This was our first visit to Baltimore and we did enjoy it. We found a cute Irish bar around the corner from the hotel on Charles St. - O'Shea's I think, which was fun. We also visited the inner harbor, the aquarium for $8 after 5pm and Fells Point which was quaint with the cobblestone streets. It was nice to be there without crowds. I would recommend the hotel to anyone who is looking for a pleasant place to sleep at the end of the day, not a fancy resort or bellmen to carry your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gwiggs1
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms. Awesome hot breakfast, with omelettes made to order. If you are a light sleeper like me, remember to ask for an inside room. Covered parking under the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Ryan E
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for two nights during a business trip and I have nothing but good things to say. I was weary about this place after reading some of the reviews, but I found a LivingSocial deal and decided to give it a shot. I was pleasantly surprised. Granted, this is not a 5 Star Hotel or one of the brand new harbor hotels, but my room and bathroom were clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Case in point, during my 1st night my room was very warm (I prefer to sleep in the cold) and after going to the front desk to complain, they informed me that because it was a historic property the Heating/AC was centrally controlled. To accommodate my discomfort, they immediately provided me with a large floor fan and when that wasn't enough they gave me an entirely different room that was much cooler. They even offered to help transfer my luggage at 1am. My new room stayed perfectly cool the rest of my stay and they also let me continue to use my floor fan. Additionally, when I wanted extra towels there was no delay from housekeeping and they sent more than I would need during my entire stay (which made me very happy!). I'm not sure if it was because of my LivingSocial deal of if it comes standard with any room rental, but each morning there was a free breakfast included in their cafe. This wasn't just a continental breakfast but a full buffet of scrambled eggs, fried potatoes, pancakes, waffles, bacon, cereals, muffins and danishes, fresh fruits, and a build your own omelette station. It's not Ruth's Chris but it's also a lot better than the Sherton's continental options. The parking was tight like other ppl have mentioned, but I had no problem finding a spot during the week days I stayed, and that was at any point I came or went btw 2pm and 11pm. All in all, I had a great 2 days there and I will be returning again. Just remember you're not in a resort, and enjoy your stay with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, centrally located,Historic area!”
Reviews.Author: iamskybluepink
Reviews.Content: Thanks Dan for greeting us personally! The building, garage clean and well lit. Rooms were average, clean, with basic ammenities. The breakfast had a large array of different food that would please most tastes, it was staffed by students of the Culinary School. Location was center city in the historic district. I walked the area by myself to visit the Bascilica and the Enoch Pratt Library, just around the corner. Very beautiful, don't miss! The Circulator bus was only about 2 blocks away and will take you around town for free (yes, free). Pick up the route maps on the bus. What you should know about this Hotel: Older hotel with average rooms, quiet, clean and affordable.(Mgr: pillows need updated!) Located in center city but with access to the inner harbor thru free public transit On site garage but PLEASE NOTE: the parking is tight, Large SUV or trucks are a bad idea. Breakfast, nice assortment, clean and large eating area, pleasent attendents! Staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Amy K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mount Vernon Hotel this weekend after purchasing a deal on living social. Having read some of the previous reviews, I was a little worried. I was pleasantly surprised to find out how wonderful this hotel was! The room was clean and comfortable. If you're worried about noise, request to stay on the 3rd floor rooms 305-309. Our window looked out onto a private lot. We heard no street noise. Some people had mentioned homeless people outside of the hotel....we saw no homeless people hanging around. The hotel was in a great area. It's a two block walk from the Charm City Circulator which is a free bus which will take you to all the city's major destination including inner harbor. The hotel is also a $7 cab ride to and and from inner harbor. If you are looking for a nice, clean place to stay in Baltimore, this hotel is the one! We will definitely be staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great area”
Reviews.Author: Krissie W
Reviews.Content: An excellent experience all around. The rooms were very clean and spacious. The room temperature was perfect and we didn't have to mess with the thermostat at all. The staff was very helpful. I was on the 6th floor and it was very quiet - no street noise or sound from other rooms. The neighborhood is amazing. I definitely never felt unsafe at any time and I was traveling late at night. The architecture blew my mind. There are quite a few coffee shops and ethnic restaurants around. The location is great if you plan on visiting some of Baltimore's more popular neighborhoods, like Hampden and Fells Point, because it's very close to the bus line and smack dab in the middle of both.

Reviews.Title: “tolerable”
Reviews.Author: visitor00
Reviews.Content: As most have already noted, this hotel is showing its age. Decor is dated, furniture is worn or nicked, and heating/cooling is a bit unpredictable. However, there are very few 2-3 star hotels in Mt Vernon. Given this and the reasonable cost, this place is perfectly acceptable for shorts stays if you're simply using it for a home base. Two areas of disappointment. (1) room service tray from previous guest was still at the room door when we checked in at 5pm. (2) uneven service: while reception staff was pleasant during check-in, staff at check-out could not even be bothered to look up at us when we checked out - kinda reminded me of the ambivalent service you get at the DMV. We tried to resolve an issue regarding parking (the hotel parking lot was full when we checked in so we had to park elsewhere), their attitude was that it wasn't their problem. YOU'RE IN THE HOSPITALITY INDUSTRY - looking a guest in the face when they're speaking to you should be the most basic act of hospitality, even if you can't help them with a specific issue. So I don't dislike the place, but we probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: missmins
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of a deal on Living Social. After looking at other hotels such as the Kimpton and Marriotts, this was a bit disappointing. Let me start off this review by saying the staff was VERY nice and friendly and it's not their fault the room wasn't that great. The building is historic and they only either have air conditioning or heat. We were (un)lucky enough to get there when the moved to heat. The room was already hot to begin with and we did not know of this one-track system so we turned the thermostat down to 50 degrees and put the setting on low. I woke up in the middle of the night thinking I was suffocating it was so ungodly hot in there. The windows don't open so there was no relief. The next night we requested a box fan that helped, but we still slept with no covers. If you do stay here - get late night pizza from Brother's...delicious!! Also, on a good weather day you can take a 15 minute walk down to the inner harbor. We went to the aquarium which was tons of fun and then stopped at some local bars.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: WVUJanie
Reviews.Content: We got a room at the Mount Vernon for the night before our cruise! After reading some of the comments I was really worried, but decided that we'd try and see what it was like! Boy, were we pleasantly surprised!! The room was HUGE!!! Yes, it's an old building...but has so much history! The restaurant in the hotel is run by the Baltimore International Culinary School. So, we had a marvelous dinner and a great breakfast!!! The price of the room was great - and included breakfast, the dinner was most reasonably priced as well. If I had a complaint - it would be the parking area...but it was in an old building...so they didn't make spaces for huge cars!! I'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “check their heat/ac settings before you go.”
Reviews.Author: katrina_traveller
Reviews.Content: This is an old building so they have heating or ac, and as of October 23rd it was AC. I bought a voucher on a deal website, did a reservation in advance, confirmed it at the day of my stay. But when I came there was only one room left, sure enough wrong type(why did I get confirmation before?). And it was cold, and there were no more blankets. So everything there seemed to be on a first come first serve basis. It didn't help that I had a reservation with a note of late arriving. Everyone there was extremely nice but couldn't do anything. They really did their best to fit us in the garage(first come first serve). And we would probably stay at the smaller room. It was clean but too cold to stay. And the fact that there were no extra blankets left confirms I am not being too picky. We were left in the middle of the night to go somewhere else. And the manager in the morning told us he couldn't do anything about it as we bought the voucher through the deal website. By the way we ended up staying at Days Inn Baltimore West, security blvd, which is a 20 minute drive from there mostly on highway, just in case you'll get in the same situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price — large rooms, clean, nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: Niia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Mount Vernon, one of Baltimore's more interesting neighborhoods, close to many cultural institutions — museums, music and more. My rate of $66 which I secured online got me a huge room with two comfortable double beds and a large bathroom with bath amenities. The place was quiet and while older and not fancy, it's perfectly fine if you're looking for a nice, basic place to stay. I've spent three times the price for rooms in the Inner Harbor that were not a whole lot nicer (and a lot smaller). Everything was clean, the front desk staff was pleasant and helpful and I really had no complaints. I had to leave very early in the morning so didn't get to try the breakfast, but I will be back there the next time I'm in Baltimore. What a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous weekend!”
Reviews.Author: smwilkins74
Reviews.Content: Just stayed the weekend at the historic Mount Vernon Hotel. I have to say that the hotel was very nice, the room was clean, and the staff was beyond accommodating. The hotel offered a complimentary breakfast, that was very tasty. We were with in walking distance of the Inner Harbor and other tourist attractions, which made the location ideal. I would gladly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, poor response”
Reviews.Author: ldymnky
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel for a last minute 2-night get-away. It was priced right and was AAA rated. When I made the reservation, the staff was very friendly. That was the last of the quality service. The hotel is about 7 blocks from the Harbor, in an ok section of town, near a hospital. The lobby was dark and rather uninviting. The room was small and basic, the bathroom, even smaller. We requested a king bed. The room was cold when we arrived and we adjusted the thermostat on the wall marked "AC/HEAT". I set it at 72 degrees figuring that would be a relatively decent temperature. In the bathroom there were two towels, one hand towel and two washcloths. There was a small single cup hot pot to make instant coffee. Not a coffee maker as advertised. The bed had two pillows that went flat when you laid your head on them and was hard as a rock. The sheets and blankets were 1980's less than "Ho-Jo" quality and there were no extra blankets or pillows. We asked at the desk for an extra set of towels and pillows. They were delivered while we were out. We decided to make the best of our trip and forged on. The temperature in our room never got warmer. As a matter of fact, it got colder and having no additional blankets to throw on did not help. We set the temperature gauge to 90 degrees with no luck. When attempting to take a shower the next morning we discovered that you could turn the water on and turn the water off. That is it. You could not turn the knob in either direction to change the temperature. When we called the front desk on a phone that crackled and had static we were told by the front desk, "Sorry, maintenance will not be in for another 2 hours." It was 6:30 in the morning. We asked what else they could do for us as we needed to take showers and get our day started. Once we prompted them, we were offered to move to another room on the first floor. (Let me remind you the hotel is situated near a hospital, we heard sirens going at all hours of the night from the 5th floor.) My boyfriend went down to the front desk to speak to a manager. When he arrived at the front desk, he was greeted by a woman on the phone holding a personal call. He and the woman behind him waited patiently until she was able to take a break and ask them what they wanted. He asked to speak to a manager and was given a so-called housekeeping manager that chucked her arms and asked him "...what he wanted her to do about it. Maintenance would not be in for two hours." He returned to the room, remembering we had a mini buck tool with us; he attempted to fix the shower himself so we could promptly check out. He jimmied the shower enough to get clean; meanwhile a housekeeper was sent to our room. We informed him that we "fixed" the shower ourselves, and that we were checking out. He was nice enough to inform us that the air conditioning was still on the building and showed us how to jiggle the temperature gauge to get a warmer temperature in our room. I will note, this gentleman was very nice to me and was just a messenger sent to an unfortunate situation. He also informed me that the woman who supposedly was the housekeeping manager, was NOT so. He did make a phone call to find out when a real manager would be on duty. When we checked out, we asked for a manager, and were given the accounting manager. When she questioned the front desk receptionist about the incident earlier, the woman replied that she was on the phone with maintenance. When my boyfriend contradicted her, she rolled her eyes and sighed at us. The accounting manager adjusted our bill and informed us we would not be charged for the additional night. She was polite and apologetic. She also explained to us at that time that the maintenance department was at a mandatory meeting at another facility. No one had given us this response to this point. We were simply told maintenance would not be in for two hours. An explanation would have been helpful and understood. Upon arriving home, I checked my card statement and found we were actually charged for a half a night (the agreed amount for the first night) AND we were charged for the second night. I contacted the hotel to clear up the matter. I spoke to the exact same woman I spoke to when we checked out. I informed her that we did NOT stay the second night and I wanted the charges removed from my charge card. She put me on hold, when she returned she said "The card has been credited, thank you, good bye" and almost hung up on me. When I asked her to confirm that again, that the charge was being credited back to my account she said "Yes, the card has been credited, thank you, good bye." at which point, she hung up on me. We have stayed in some interesting establishments before. We have made the best of them, but this is by far the worst experience either of us has ever had. And they are supposedly a AAA rated hotel. We will be contacting them next.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: manali1
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a great breakfast, it is so filling. The location is very good and the charges are very reasonable also. A clean and cosy room!

Reviews.Title: “great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: pamelaanne68
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I just checked out this morning, and we enjoyed our stay at the Mount Vernon Hotel. I was a bit afraid of booking a room here after reading some of the reviews on tripadvisor, but I refuse to pay Inner Harbor prices -- I like a view, but I don't NEED a view -- and I was VERY pleasantly surprised that it was much nicer than I thought it would be. From the moment we entered the lobby to check in until the moment we left, EVERY staff member was friendly, helpful, and quick to answer our questions and attend to our needs. We asked for more pillows, and they were brought to us within 10 minutes. We left for dinner, and when we got back to the parking garage, someone had taken up two spaces, and the rest of the spots were taken -- I waited in the car while my fiancee went to the lobby to see what we could do -- the clerk had the non-parker move their car, and we had our space. We had leftovers from dinner, but no flatware -- it was brought within 10 minutes. The breakfast staff was very friendly as well. The room wasn't huge, but it was CLEAN, as was the bathroom. I don't know if bedbugs have made it to Baltimore yet, but if they have, they're not checked in at the Mount Vernon. We had a decent view of the city from our window. My only kinda-sorta complaint about the room is that the coffee pot is a single-serving pot, but since they give you a free full breakfast, I had plenty of coffee when we went down to eat, and took a large cup back up to our room. I'm sure that had I asked, they would have been more than happy to bring more coffee pods up to the room, but it wasn't needed. The breakfast was pretty good -- scrambled eggs with cheese, home fries, potato casserole (basically home fries with bacon, ham, and cheddar), french toast, and bacon. They also had turkey bacon for those who don't dig on swine. They also had muffins, bagels, toast, cereal, fruit, and yogurt. The coffee wasn't bad for hotel coffee -- as I said, I drank a TON of it. They also had a very good juice selection -- not just your standard orange and apple -- they also had cranberry and grape juices. To those that gave bad reviews, I have a few pointers for you: 1. You are in the CITY. There are going to be panhandlers, homeless people, and weirdos near your hotel no matter where you stay. This is true for ANY large city, not just Baltimore. 2. Rudeness begets rudeness. If you have a problem, but are polite to the staff while explaining your problem, chances are that the staff will be polite to you and help you in any way they can. However, if you are rude, obnoxious, demanding, and unreasonable, don't expect anyone to bend over backward to appease you. You catch more flies with honey than vinegar, honey, so be sweet. 3. If you're picky about pillows, bring your own, or ask for more. I'm picky about pillows, so usually bring my own when I travel, but since we were only staying one night, I didn't this time. I asked for more, and they were promptly delivered. 4. Why would you complain about a free breakfast? I'll take the Mount Vernon's breakfast in a SECOND over the typical Continental that most hotels offer -- I'm not interested in cereal or mini-muffins if there's REAL food available. 5. The parking garage is small and the spaces aren't huge, yes. However, if you have any sense, you will have already read the other reviews and know this. We brought our smaller car for just that reason (and also because we didn't know how much street parking we'd need to do while wandering around Baltimore, so the smaller the car, the better.) 6. If you want to stay in a five-star, STAY IN A FIVE-STAR.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy.”
Reviews.Author: Xyzmama
Reviews.Content: This was more like a homeless shelter. It actually does house displaced people for the Baltimore area. There were panhandlers in front. Garage was creepy. Located on a dark street you had to get out of your car to open door. Breakfast is dormitory style. Maybe because this hotel is also used as a dorm for a local college. The help at the front desk were pleasant and cordial. However this is not a place for me. I travel to Baltimore at least every 6 wks so I know for the money, there are better places.

Reviews.Title: “Just read my review”
Reviews.Author: GeraldWLee
Reviews.Content: Okay so I see some reviews on here that are negative. Maybe, I stayed at a good time. Lol The only thing I have to say is some off the staff aren't to friendly that work on the floor and in the dining area. They can be rude. Also, the smell in front of the hotel is bad. It is a cheap stay compared to other hotels. The breakfast was good. You can't want to much for the price. The room was clean and the bathroom was nice. Wifi threw the hotel that's free. Close to downtown with free buses.

Reviews.Title: “An easily overlooked place close to downtown.”
Reviews.Author: SouthCentralPA_11
Reviews.Content: Our daughter had surgery at a downtown medical center at Six in the morning. We live in South-Central PA and we needed a realtively inexpensive place near downtown for the night before. The Mount Vernon Hotel was nothing fancy, but it was very clean and the folks there couldn't have been nicer. Parking under the hotel is extremely limited, but there is a public garage directly across the street. If you're looking for a destination hotel, keep looking. If you're interested in a relatively affordable place to sleep at night that's close to everything, this is the place. (And FWIW my daughter's surgery was a success!)

Reviews.Title: “Crud hole”
Reviews.Author: orphicdragon
Reviews.Content: I type this review from the Mount Vernon Hotel room where I am currently a guest on the fifth floor. I check out tomorrow and I could not be happier to be leaving. I feel like I got ripped off royally. I will be spending more $$ to stay elsewhere when I have to come back Short version: The good: Location Room size The "eh": Price ( I paid just under $100 per night) Bed comfort The Ugly: Parking Homeless people congregating and following you Clueless Guest Reps Did I say parking? Dirty Old (Not the quaint charming vintage "old" but the beat down only doing the basics old) The manager "Ben" is pretty useless. Details: I am not from Baltimore. I am from a small town in Florida. Normally, this would not be a problem but apparently the folks at Mount Vernon Hotel have ZERO idea that people from other places visit this city. Directions are always the same, "10 minutes THAT way" or "two blocks down". Down?? Down where? What way? Half these streets are one way, you have to turn 17 times to get a mile worth of progress to your destination. A name a street SOMETHING USEFUL?! Nope, you're on your own. Thank god we stumbled upon a traffic officer who took pity and explained to us about the free orange and purple buses. NOT ONE REP mentioned this free bus thing that is literally just down on the corner. I thought maybe it was just the reps I had talked to. Maybe I was just unlucky or something, but tonight after arriving at the hotel (10:30pm) and finding NO parking despite the fact that they have my 15$ Ben, the manager, says "sorry I guess someone took two spots" and directs us to parking by pointing and saying "2 blocks that way". Real helpful Mr. Manager, I appreciate that. The hotel is old. They call it historic and vintage and all sorts of nice things. It WOULD be those things if they bothered to clean anything worth a darn. They clean the stuff you can see at first glance. Everything else is left to grow fuzzy and gross. The ice machine is raggedy and grimy looking. The ice seems clean I suppose but I looked it over pretty hard before using it and still didn't feel comfortable with it. I ended up using it like cooler ice and just dropped my drink bottle in it. I'm not generally nit picky but with the sludge on the toilet seat, the trash I had to trip over to get on the elevator, and the fuzzy brown junk in the tub I wasn't really taking any chances. I ended up having to take a picture of the trash and show the counter to get it picked up. Parties and stuff happen, it's a hotel, what is so difficult about giving guests a place to put their trash?! The ice room is already a dump, one good sized trash can is hardly going to ruin the ambiance. Location, location, location. This is a good one for the sights and local flavor of Baltimore. However, there are many others that are just as convenient, cleaner and are not directly across the street from a women's center. Homeless people like to congregate there. Homeless people are all over the city, it's a big city, it is unavoidable. However if you are going to drop $100+ a night you should get a heads up that it's possible packs of them will be in your face when you leave the hotel via the front door. They don't "harass" but they do hover around you and will ask for food, money or whatever. The homeless are people and deserve respect and a measure of understanding, but there is a large amount of mentally ill homeless and frankly I don't feel safe walking through 4-5 homeless men at 8pm on a street I barely know in an unfamiliar city.This would not be an issue if you could actually park at the hotel. The tiny little underground parking is like a real live game of traffic. I had no trouble parking, but I can actually parallel park, and back into a spot. Many other people are apparently unable to do this. So, even though you paid 15$ and they tell you that you will have a spot its more of a YMMV sort of thing. They make this better by saying "We don't charge you until you check out". Wow, but you do place a hold on my card for the cash, and you do tell me I have a spot...alrighty then. I can completely see how this is my fault, thank you for allowing me to park three blocks away and walk back to the rat hole that is my current abode. They know which guest is parked wonky and can ask them to come park UNwonky, but why exert effort or care. It's only a guest after all, and it would interrupt the little social circle they have happening behind the front desk. You get a free breakfast every morning for every guest. It was hit and miss. Day one eggs were good, bacon was burnt. Day two Eggs were burnt bacon appeared ok, but then we both ended up puking bacon chunks for the remainder of the morning. Tomorrow I am just going to go hungry till I grab something from the terminal food providers. So tomorrow, I check out at 5am and walk the 5 blocks to my car. I am sure every step away from this dump will be a pleasant one. The real shame is, I wanted to love this place. I am tired of the same old hotel chain cookie cutter boredom. I bought inot the hype and truly thought this would add a level of excitement and novelty to my trip here. Oh how horribly wrong I was. Goodbye and good riddance Mount Vernon Hotel may we NEVER meet again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: sharriewatson
Reviews.Content: We don't live too far from Baltimore but wanted to stay overnight a few nights because we were going to the Baltimore Grand Prix over Labor Day Weekend. We looked at the hotels in the Inner Harbor but decided we really didn't need to spend that much. The Mount Vernon Hotel was close enough that we felt we could easily walk to the Inner Harbor. Being relatively local, we did a 'drive by' and felt comfortable so we booked it for the weekend at much less than the Inner Harbor would have cost. It was the right decision! The hotel staff was friendly, the room clean and the bed comfortable. My husband and I are not big breakfast eaters but on the second day, the breakfast looked so good that we decided to check it out and it did not disappoint. Although there are buses (and some free I think) we didn't check it out because we wanted to walk. Other reviews have confirmed our impression that this was a pretty safe section of Baltimore to walk through and we were very glad we stayed here. Staying in the city one needs to expect some noise but each night was quiet - an unexpected bonus. (But it sure wasn't quiet when we got close the the Harbor for the race!)

Reviews.Title: “Overall pleased.”
Reviews.Author: Maureen F
Reviews.Content: Nice old hotel with a lovely foyer. Reception person very helpful. Room nice size and clean. Flat pillows and very light blankets. Wished I had something a bit heavier. Free breakfast a plus and it was good. The price I paid was decent. Overall I was pleased.

Reviews.Title: “A delightfull surprise.”
Reviews.Author: Brewer1954
Reviews.Content: I am not much of a city person but going to Baltimore Inner Harbor and staying at the Mount Vernon Hotel was a delightfull surprise that turned our two day trip into an enjoyable family mini vacation. The Mount Vernon Hotel was very clean, nicely decorated, friendly atmosphere, very affordable, and offered a hot and cold breakfast selecton in a beautifully decorated style cafe. In door parking was available for $15 dollars a day and a free Baltimore bus service stop was only 2 short blocks away. Information on the bus schedules and routes was provided by the hotel along with brochures on most of the attractions located around Baltimore Inner Harbor. The Mount Vernon Washington Monument was only two blocks away and the surrounding area was clean, safe and attractive. I would highly recommend this hotel and I and my family plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaNan
Reviews.Content: Just echoing other positive reviews of this hotel. Excellent hot breakfast in a pleasant setting, helpful staff, clean room. Walters museum, Enoch Pratt free library right around the corner and boy did we use that free Charm City Circulator bus back and forth to Inner Harbor (love the American Visionary Art Museum). Walked to City Café on Eager Street for great dinner. Good rate, too. Who needs the big chains?

Reviews.Title: “If the room was clean the neighborhood would have looked better...”
Reviews.Author: Ileane
Reviews.Content: Arrived by cab from the airport on a Friday night, and the neighborhood looked a little rough. The bathroom wasn't very clean, the shampoo was from China, and no conditioner. The towels were thin. Bed had only two flat pillows. The hot breakfast was a plus, and when we took a cab to the nearby Inner Harbor, we felt better about being in Baltimore for a wedding. However, I found garbage in my sheets from another guest later the first morning, and it soured my stay. I told the manager after my 2nd night, and he said that was "a real shame." The price was right, and the staff was friendly, but all I required was a clean room.

Reviews.Title: “made me love baltimore”
Reviews.Author: erlich5
Reviews.Content: gotta say that I wasnt a lover of baltimore. think on my first trip, had a bad experience but had to enter baltimore again, and I choose this hotel, the mount vernon. Had to say that upon first entering I was told that they had no rooms with double beds but Tom was nice enuff to upgrade me to another room. Just had to use the pull out couch. I didnt mind. just needed a safe place and clean place to stay. The breakfast (included in the price) at first I thought was a bit bland, but after a while it grew on me. Hey..its free! Bed was comfortable, pillows was hard, so I had bought my own.( thanks to previous trip advisor members who took the time to alert me to the hard pillows ahead of time, so I bought my comforty soft one! )The neighborhood is ok. I am an avid exerciser and after the first jog, further from the hotel, I decided against doing that again. Too deserted. As I said earlier, i dont like Baltimore on a whole, but after staying here for five nights, I have changed my mind. If I go back to baltimore, I would definately make this my hotel of choice. Feel free to say there. Its a good value for the buck!..

Reviews.Title: “Much more than expected.”
Reviews.Author: Lilukalani
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews on this hotel and had mixed feelings but I was very pleasantly surprised. My sister and I had a corner room, which was bigger than the other rooms, and the bed was pretty comfortable. The AC worked perfectly and sometimes it got a little too cold for our tastes but you can turn it down and change the air temperature. The room was also very quiet and there wasn't any problems going to sleep. The hotel staff was incredibly friendly and very helpful. When we woke up, we took showers and noticed that the water pressure was very good. They only offer shampoo (From the looks of it, it didn't have conditioner in it), soap and body wash. There's a hair dryer in the bathroom as well along with a coffee maker. After we showered, we went down to eat breakfast and were very surprised at how much they offered. The first day there was pancakes, bacon, breakfast sausage, eggs, hash browns and 4 types of cereal. The second day, instead of pancakes, it was french toast. The breakfast, in my opinion, was very good! I liked it a lot and it was just amazing to me how much they offered for being a complimentary breakfast. For dinner, there are a lot of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. My sister and I ate at this authentic Thai restaurant that was absolutely incredible. It was very easy to walk back and forth to places. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are very nice, the service is incredibly friendly and the location is very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DIANAMC405
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during a visit to the Inner Harbor. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The staff was incredibly friendly and very helpful (directions, information about the harbor and the free shuttle that takes you around town). Eric greeted us at the front desk and was very friendly and also advised on the parking lots (since the one for the hotel was full) There is a no smoking policy in the hotel but our loft did have a smell of cigarette smoke. We made the staff aware before check out and they said they would look into it and apologized for it. Other than that, my family and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for price, perks and decent location!”
Reviews.Author: laineylains
Reviews.Content: I travel to Baltimore once a year and was a bit worried about the distance from the convention centre but it wasn't bad at all. A short walk (4 blocks) west of the hotel is the Light Rail train that takes you to the airport, very convenient. Stayed at this hotel with an awesome deal of $55/night. Free hot breakfast (eggs, bacon, and sometimes french toast, biscuit and gravy, pancakes), free WIFI, free service for accepting parcels (fancier hotels charge like $10 a box, and this important for those who need this service) and a free shuttle bus nearby that takes you to the Baltimore Convention Centre. What more could you ask for? Renovated rooms, AC was fine (although a bit too cold), the hallways had no AC but I didn't mind (saves the environment and energy). The main lobby had a nice mini grand piano (out of tune) with very friendly and inviting staff. I had a very good stay here and even the walk to the convention center is not that far. Otherwise you can hop onto the free shuttle bus or take public transit ($1.60/ride). My friends and I were extremely impressed with the clean and spacious rooms and the amazing service. I gave an employee a healhy tip at the front desk for helping me move my giant boxes around! I had some friends who stayed at other hotels in the area and they received very rude treatment from the staff. I paid much less but was given nothing but top quality service and I told the staff that I will return and advise all of my friends to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: BAM1953
Reviews.Content: Location is good...on Purple Route of FREE Circulator Bus...took that free bus from Penn Station after arriving on the train...very convenient. Hotel is within 1 mile of Inner Harbor...I easily walked to Inner Harbor from the hotel. Had AC problem in my room, hotel staff responded promptly & fixed it fast! Breakfast was good. Friendly, responsive staff. One negative: the hallway smelled musty...as if the carpeting had gotten wet. But the odor was not in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “great price, good location”
Reviews.Author: armymomME
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel made it easy to access public transportation. The buses and train were 1-3 blocks away. The hotel staff was very helpful, room clean, bed comfortable. This was hot weather in Baltimore and the air conditioner worked to keep the room comfortable. Breakfast had good options to choose from, eggs, bacon, cereal, bagels, yogurt, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal in great location”
Reviews.Author: SMO23
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because some fellow travelers were staying here, it ended up being a great time. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, they went out of their way to assist with providing information about getting around and things to see. The hotel itself is not too fancy, but it is pretty decent for the price and the breakfast buffet was fantastic. You could ask for a better location, but you would be paying twice as much. For the price the location was outstanding. Mt Vernon is a great area to wander around, and it is not too bad of a walk down to the Inner Harbor. There are museums, shops and restaurants/pubs in the immediate area (Cozy Corner across the street from Walters Art Museum is a good place to stop for food!). I booked a package that included parking in the building and I am glad I did. You could only access the garage from the outside with your room key, so did not have to worry too much about just leaving it there for the 3 days I stayed. If I end up back in the area I will most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You are the best!!”
Reviews.Author: queenie03
Reviews.Content: My husband needed to be at Johns Hopkins for a heart procedure so he and I stayed at your hotel together the first night and I stayed by myself at the hotel the second night because he needed to be observed overnight at Hopkins. Under such stressful circumstances, we could not have been in a nicer, cleaner and more welcoming environment than at your hotel. It's in the middle of the art neighborhood and walking distance to the waterfront. The room was huge and well appointed and immaculately clean. Your staff couldn't do enough for us i.e. extra pillows, passes for breakfast, cab fare back and forth to Hopkins and making recommendations to several wonderful restaurants a block or two away. Thank you and your staff for providing such a relaxed and nurturing atmosphere at a time of uncertainty and stress regarding my husband's procedure which by the way, was successful in getting and keeping his heart into shape. Thanks for a healing and pleasant visit to Baltimore. Best, Pauline King [...]

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: hamatosan
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed. Upon check in, was informed that I was booked in a room with ONE double bed. Two adults, one small child travelling. Asked if we could move rooms. Without a second's hesitation, clerk said no, they were booked up. Paid ten dollars for a cot, which smelled like it hadn't been washed in 20 years. Called the hotel later that night and asked if they had rooms available. Hotel's website says "Each guestroom is newly renovated to provide comfort for today's savvy traveler, either rooms with king or queen and/or rooms with either two double beds or two queens. Our 135 guestroom hotel and bi-level lofts are ideally situated for the corporate traveler, honeymoon couple and a small family taking advantage of the Baltimore sights." Horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: Daisy1034
Reviews.Content: Mount Vernon is in a great location for walking around Baltimore and the hotel parking and laundry room are convenient. It is however, not a great hotel. When we first checked in we were told we would be getting an "upgrade" to one of the corner rooms of the hotel. Imagine our surprise when we opened the door to find that the room hadn't been cleaned and looked like someone had just checked out of the room. This was about 5:30pm, so there should have been plenty of time to clean it. We were given another room on the sixth floor. The carpet in the hallways is old and worn and somewhat stained so was the room. Mismatched furniture and old carpet, a bathroom without a fan and free internet that hardly worked. The pillows were very flat and I had to fold mine to get my head at the angle I am used to sleeping. I didn't see dirt in the room, but it just felt a bit dirty. I thought the bottled water next to the ice bucket in the room was a nice touch until I read the little card on it saying that our room would be charged $2.00 if we drank it. Another annoying touch was that every time we got back from the hotel after walking around the city our room keys would not work. We had to go to the front desk every time we came back to get them re-calibrated so we could get back into our rooms. The hot breakfast was pretty good, but was only open till 9 on weekdays. Not bad unless you've been sightseeing all day and then checking out the nightlife and want to sleep in a little. . But, if you want a relatively cheap hotel both in price (by Baltimore standards) and decor that is in a good location, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: MontcoPA24
Reviews.Content: Good, reasonably priced, convenient hotel. Staff was efficient and courteous; room was clean and comfortable; complimentary breakfast was an added treat. Our first floor room was suprisingly quiet. We parked at the self-service garage across the street, which was an easy in-and-out.

Reviews.Title: “Close to inner harbour but bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: anonimus13
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a cheap feeling to it, although prices are very high. Ugly colors in the rooms, old TV and furniture, smelly rooms and hallway, noisy air conditioning, breakfast was of very poor quality. I do NOT recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to walk to Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: twofromNC
Reviews.Content: Older hotel but very clean and functionable. Has underground parking which was a little tight for my Highlander SUV but it worked. Easy walk to restaurants and then down to Inner Harbor. Baltimore now has free buses that circle the area and so we used it to come back up the hill to the hotel. Dropped us off a block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a group”
Reviews.Author: TarHeelsareBest
Reviews.Content: The Hotel worked great for a group of 30 kids. The breakfast went great for our large group. The Hotel was clean and the rooms were large. The location allowed easy access The Peabody Institude and touring the Basillica of the Assumption. It is a little bit of a walk to the waterfront, but there is free bus service nearby that worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff. Excellent Service!!”
Reviews.Author: grvolans
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting much after a disasterous stay in another hotel one day prior to our reserved stay at Mount Vernon. The front desk staff were friendly, helpful, and courteous. The rooms were very clean and spacious. Bathrooms were spotless with no mildew or mold anywhere. Cleaning staff replenished necessities every day . Beds were comfortable and we had no trouble sleeping. Free breakfasts were a plus and food quality is decent.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, extra helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: laurac044
Reviews.Content: I happened to have gotten a fantastic deal on this hotel through Priceline. Based on that price, which was less than $80.00/per night, I would definitely stay here again. I was recovering from surgery at one of the local hospitals and an extremely helpful woman at the front desk brought breakfast to my room every morning, on her own time. The hotel does not offer room service, and since I was on crutches, her efforts meant a lot to me. I thought the room was a generous size, clean. There was pretty decent free WiFi in the rooms (sometimes it would be down for a bit, but mostly it was working and with a very good speed). I have seen some people complain about the breakfasts, but I was pleasantly surprised. Bacon, sausage, french toast, home fries - all very good! The scrambled eggs weren't so great, but I was pleased with the rest of the complimentary breakfast. I requested a quiet room and had no issues with noise. I wasn't able to get out much, due to my recovery from surgery, but it's my understanding that this hotel is in a pretty centralized location. I probably wouldn't stay here at the list rates, which were about 200 per night, but I definitely would stay again and recommend the hotel for under 80 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Tobias032
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel! The rooms are very clean and very well organized, and the staff is very helpful and welcoming. The hotel is located very close to buss stops, taking you within 10 min to the city center and the inner harbor. Certainly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: entetoo
Reviews.Content: Clean room and a good staff. I'd stay again. Baltimore is a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: pha1226
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight during Spring Break (April, 2011). I got a very cheap rate on Hotwire. The hotel is not really within walking distance of anything but I'd rather take taxis than pay Inner Harbor prices. I had read here about the parking situation in advance so we parked in the public lot across Franklin St. It was very easy to get in and out of and the price was reasonable. The building and lobby of the hotel are nothing special. We had no problems checking in and the man at the front desk was efficient and polite. Our room had no view at all but was very spacious and clean. The temperature control in the room worked fine and we were very comfortable. The beds were firm and comfy and the bathroom was clean. The free wi-fi worked fine. We didn't eat the free breakfast as it ended at 9:00 am. My only issue with the hotel is that there are benches in front of the outside stairs and there always seemed to be random individuals hanging around (maybe there is a bus stop close by or something. Overall, it was a nice stay and I'd recommend the hotel for someone who doesn't mind being a little further away to save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Potentially good but needs improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Bhibsen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value as I booked it through Pricline and only paid 59.00 per might for Easter weekend. Unfortunately, there were a few very strange quirks. One, they had no heat because they had switched the system to a/c the day before we arrived and the room was cold the first night. The location is a bit sketchy, being about one block from a kind of run down neighborhood and about six from the ballpark, which was fine bit the hotel comes up on Google as right near Camden Yards. The street is also one way and you cannot park in front to unload and check in. There is underground parking but you have to check in and get your key to access it, making arrival a bit of a challenge. The staff is very friendly though a bit undertrained. I booked a room with two beds and was given one with one calefornia king. When I complained I was told there were no more rooms and nothing was done to try to rectify the situation. I should note that I was told that there is no guarantee you will get the room you book when you go through the web, and I got a GREAT price so I can't complain too much. The hot breakfast is great albeit basic, fine for me b/c I am not a huge breakfast person anyway and more substantial then at most other hotels, even more expensive ones. Another great thing was it is right across the street from he Baltimore Bassilica, so I was able to take my nephew to Easter Mass and it was conducted by the Archbishop of Baltimore! I also should note, do mob pay for the "movie deal" because it is misleading. It says it gives you 80 movies to choose from but it really just gives you a few Starz channels. Overall, a good value bit needs some improvement. Sent up extra blankets and pillows and the bed was fantastically comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: kdfrench
Reviews.Content: When I booked our room for our recent trip to Baltimore, this hotel had wonderful reviews. Shortly before our trip, there were some negative reviews. I hope my experience provides clarity for anyone who may be undecided. We had a corner room, which was really large. It was pretty clean, the furnishings were fine - typical hotel furniture. Several reviewers complained about the neighborhood. If you come to the city from the airport via the light rail, the stop is in a rundown looking area. We never felt threatened during the walk. Walking to the hotel from Penn Station or the Inner Harbor, we used other streets and felt much safer. Of course, no matter where you are, you need to be aware of your surroundings. We found the staff to be extremely friendly. We arrived to check-in around 9 pm and asked for a restaurant recommendation and the desk clerk offered a good suggestion. They also called cabs for us when need be and answered other questions about the city. Breakfast - Most of the complaints I saw related to the breakfast. The selection is limited, but some offerings are better than what you'd find in some chain hotel breakfasts. It was nice to have the choice of hot eggs and bacon instead of just fruit and boxed cereal. The quality was fare. If I traveled to Baltimore again, I would consider staying here again, but my decision would likely be driven by rates/location. I will add - there are many hotels in the Inner Harbor that were double the price. To me, the short walk was worth the savings.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday in B-more”
Reviews.Author: Kdurrant
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our reservations through Hotwire and I have to admit we were both skeptical b/c of the low rating. To our surprise we were 100 % pleased with the customer service, the cleanliness of our room and the free breakfast. The staff even suprised me with a birthday card (I'm still smiling), gave us resturant suggestions, printed out directions and responded promptly when we requested help w/ the heating system. We'll certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly Great”
Reviews.Author: lahutr
Reviews.Content: At first glance, the hotel seemed more "dated" than our liking. Quickly, the knowledgable and friendly staff made me feel so comfortable. It was one of the front desk staffs first day...I would have never known had he not mentioned it after checking us in! Thanks very much for the "non" hotel, homemade breakfast too! My 3 boys look forward to our return! One suggestion, maybe pillowtops...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms however the staff is simply mean.”
Reviews.Author: 4courtNey
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again but I would not plan on eating the complimentary breakfast. The wait staff acts as if they get paid on how little people eat. All I wanted was some coffee, and I was yelled at in front of other people when I went back for a second cup!

Reviews.Title: “I love the place!”
Reviews.Author: wdaliangiup
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful experience. Yes, it is 2.5-star hotel but Mount Vernon is one of the best in its category! Friendly staff, clean room, big TV with decent channels, GREAT hot breakfast (why did someone complain about this? ), free wireless Internet. This location could not be better!! Light rail from and to BWI airport for $1.6! Bus line 11 and 3 are around the corner which takes you downtown with 20 minutes. Talking about the corners, there are Walters Museum, library, Basilica of the Assumption, 7-11 convenient store, best Chinese restaurant in town (I'm Chinese so this is the best for me:-)), and the whole Mt. Vernon cultural area! you get to all those places mentioned above within 5 minutes on foot. I took a cultural walk in that area up to the Baltimore Museum of Art (bus 3) in spring blossom. I had to say this is one of my best experiences in many years! You can also walk for 40 minutes along Charles street to inner harbor to see all those attractions there. anyway, this is a wonderful affordable place for museum/art/architecture/history lovers like myself. I will definitely stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed, Skip Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AngelaIndigo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel on a Friday night, it was our anniversary and we wanted to stay in the city. The location is wonderful, we love Mt Vernon, but we were disappointed in the hotel. When we opened the door to our room, we were hit with a strong musty smell. The room itself was fine, clean bathroom, firm bed, but the smell really detracted from it. We had a nice quiet sleep, but were hit with another disappointment in the morning. We were told that breakfast was included, and served from 7-10am. We arrived for breakfast at 9:45 and found the cafe had a 'Closed' sign on the door. We entered anyway and the breakfast buffet was bustling with people. The woman who appeared to be in charge of the cafe was extremely rude and was loudly complaining about how guests kept entering even though the 'Closed' sign was on the door. She was very hostile towards the guests. Again it was only 9:45. People were lined up for food and pancakes were being delivered out of the kitchen to guests. I asked the woman if there were anymore pancakes and she said no. A few minutes later I saw another chef come out with more pancakes and he did give them to us and other guests. The whole thing was very disorganized and the people working there seemed very unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Mt. Vernon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SSG127
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for a birthday celebration and I am glad we found this hotel. The location of the hotel is within walking distance of the inner harbor. The front desk staff was wonderful, they helped us out getting a cab ride down to the harbor. The room was clean and neat. Nice size room for a group of four. The breakfast they served was great. Big breakfast of everything from eggs to pancakes to fruit and yogurt. Their parking garage was full, but there is another garage across the street. The only thing is does cost extra money. Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, horrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: orvalectiq
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Service ok. Noisy room and terrible breakfast. Wouldn't recommend going there. There's much better hotels out there for the same price. Could be more clean also. A lot of noisy students were staying in the hotel also.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff BUT beware of lack of individula climate control in rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Serena
Reviews.Content: We stayed Friday November 12th for one night. Although the hotel has very friendly front desk staff, is well-located, has parking available (for a fee), has free hot breakfast, and has clean rooms with all of the basics, I would not stay here again because of three problems with the physical plant itself that make it an undesireable place to stay. First, the hotel building does not have modern HVAC. This means only one form of climate control can be turned on at a time for the whole building, as the front desk staff explained to me when I called from my room which was 80 degrees and had all the drapes wide open letting in all the heat from the sun when I entered it. Although we visited in November, the temperatures were in the 60s and 70s, which is not at all unusual for this region of the country. Instead of having the heat on for the whole property, it would have been much better to have it off at least during the day so that the temperature would have been closer to bearable. I was not informed of this climate control situation when I made the reservation (through Hotwire, to whom I have also written about the issue) or when I checked in at the front desk. Unfortunately because I was not informed, I entered the very hot room (est. upper 80s at least) and immediately turned on the A/C, not having any way to know that this would cause the fan to just pump more hot air into the room, because the A/C was disabled completely. There was no signage on the thermostat/climate control knobs in the room to inform me of this fact. The response of the front desk was apologetic, and they did send up a fan, but the fan was very weak and in no way sufficient to cool the room. The temperature made it uncomfortable to even just sit and try and relax in. It turned the room into a sauna: if you showered (with bathroom door closed) and then came out of the shower you would just end up sweating immediately. In fact, the room was so uncomfortable that we ended up propping the door open while we were in it and awake, just to let some of the air from the corridor in. The room discomfort resulted in us altering some plans and leaving Baltimore before we had planned to leave. Second problem: The room we had faced the street and there is no soundproofing to speak of so it was very difficult to sleep from the street noise plus the heat. This noise problem did not really become apparent until all of the Friday night/early Saturday morning street noise commotion with sirens etc. started, when everyone in the room was quiet and in bed trying to sleep - which of course is not the time you want to get up, get dressed, and find out if there is possibly another room available away from the street. I take melatonin as a sleep aid, which works very well for me, but the noise was an impediment to sleep that melatonin could not overcome. Third: The parking deck, which costs $15 per night and is under the hotel so it must be accessed by going around a couple of blocks because of the one way streets, is very cramped with spaces that are very tight and awkwardly position and thus very difficult to navigate and park in. Also, on exiting the deck, there is some concrete lump or something that scrapes the underside of your car badly on the way out. I have to go get my car looked at now, and I am very concerned that damage was done. I drive a Nissan Altima, which is probably average clearance from the ground and I would not expect to encounter such a problem with a parking structure. As I said, the hotel is well-located, has friendly front desk staff, and clean rooms with all the basic furnishings and fixtures you would expect for the hotel class. The staff was helpful, even printing out my concert ticket confirmation sheet that I mistakenly left at home, and calling a cab for me when I needed one. However, the bottom line is this: it is hard to predict the weather, and I want to be in control of the room temperature when I travel so that I am able to enjoy the room and shower and sleep in comfort. The street noise and parking issues are also factors with decrease the desireability of the room, but lack of climate control is the biggest negative.

Reviews.Title: “Nice historic hotel in heart of Mt Vernon District”
Reviews.Author: Visitor58350
Reviews.Content: Friendly hotel staff, good breakfast in lobby cafe, great location in Mt Vernon District of downtown Baltimore. A half block from the free purple Circulator Bus which runs from the Inner Harbor to Penn Station every 10 minutes. The bed was very comfortable, but the walls are thin and the rooms are small. Free Wifi is also a nice plus. Perfect for a single traveler.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: fearslady
Reviews.Content: For the price, I did not know what to expect, but I was pleasantly surprised. The room was large and comfortable and most of all CLEAN. The parking garage was right underneath the hotel so we did not even have to cross the street, but take note it is not designed for larger autos/trucks so if you are not driving a small car or SUV there is a public parking garage across the street. There was a hot breakfast from 6 to 9 am with freshly made food that looked pretty good. The staff was friendly. I stayed here while a family member had surgery at Johns Hopkins and I am looking forward to returning with my family sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: hannypops
Reviews.Content: The Mount Vernon is well-located; just a few blocks from the Inner Harbour and not far in a cab from Fells Point. We got mixed up with parking and parked in a lot across the street but the hotel does have parking too, although it wasn't that easy for us to find. The room's were ok - nothing too fancy - but the bathroom was good. Breakfast was fine, they don't serve hot food but have pastries, fruit and cereal - and everyone who worked here was really friendly and helpful. It's a great city and it would have been super to stay here longer, and it would have been perfectly comfy in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab & fun value!”
Reviews.Author: MaryFredTallahassee
Reviews.Content: Whaddya' get for $110/night? Well, you get a big, clean and quiet room with comfy beds. You get a free hot breakfast. You get free off-street secure parking (in the tightest parking lot I've ever seen!). The hotel is in a fab historic part of Baltimore, within walking distance of great restaurants, bars, museums, and America's original cathedral.
