Our room didn't have a view but hey, who stays inside their hotel room all day long? It was a great stay at a great price! This was our second stay at MVH and I highly recommend it. I've read some of the negative reviews and quite frankly, those folks need to stay home--they'd be happier.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, wonderful price!”
Reviews.Author: Beckster16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a place to stay that was close to Inner Harbor without costing a fortune. Mt.Vernon fit the bill. The owners have done a commendable job renovating the building which was formerly a YMCA. Our room was cozy and clean; we only had to ask for more tissues which were promptly brought to the room. The hot breakfast was a real plus as well, including scrambled eggs, hot apples, breakfast potatoes with peppers and onions, biscuits and gravy. There was also a selection of cereals and breads. You can park across the street in a garage with full in and out privileges for $10 a night! The free Walters Museum is only a few blocks away. We'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at a great value”
Reviews.Author: Yankeefan83
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed two nights at Mount Vernon when we visited Baltimore to watch the Yankees and Orioles. I was very pleased with the hotel. We arrived at 2am. The attendant at the front desk in the lobby was very nice and helpful. They have a small parking area in front of the hotel for people arriving. It comes in handy to check in and get a parking pass for their garage , which is under the hotel ($15 a day but worth it). The room we had was big, very clean, and up to date. It was also quiet despite being right in the middle of the city. The hotel is close to the Inner Harbor and Oriole Park, around 1 mile away give or take. In the day time, I wouldn't have any issues walking from the hotel to the ballpark or harbor. That said, the area the hotel is in is a little sketchy, and maybe not the safest area, so I wouldn't recommend walking back to the hotel at night. There is tons of parking around the harbor and ballpark, so I'd recommend driving to those locations if you're planning to come back to the hotel late. Overall, it was a pleasurable stay, close to everything, and it met and exceeded all my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience at a great value”
Reviews.Author: Mr_McD
Reviews.Content: The Mount Vernon was a nice hotel in a great, convenient location with exceptionally friendly & helpful staff manning the front desk. They have their own secure, tiny parking garage below the hotel that costs $15 extra to utilize. The room was very clean and the bed & pillows were nice and comfortable... for once, I had no problem at all falling asleep in a hotel. The only very minor issues for me were that the thermostat in the room was set to 60 degrees with the a/c blasting when I arrived (felt like a meat locker... turned the temperature up and went for a walk to let the room warm up a little), and the next morning, my "hot" breakfast wasn't so hot, though I did arrive right at the tail end of breakfast service, so I am willing to cut them some slack for this. This probably sounds really minor, but being that I was in town on business and that my shirt had gotten really badly wrinkled in the suitcase, I was really happy to have an iron in my room that worked so effectively. I was really happy overall with my stay, and I plan on returning to the Baltimore and the Mount Vernon next year with my wife for our 10 year wedding Anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “A well kept hotel in the heart of the historic district..”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid84
Reviews.Content: A free standing hotel with views over Baltimore's historic district and easy access to the city's many attractions. We found it clean and pleasant and we enjoyed a full and delicious breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “All Around A-O-K”
Reviews.Author: ashfordst
Reviews.Content: Real good location - close enough to everything without being in a real busy area. Nice room. Very friendly and helpful staff. Hot breakfast - a lot better that dropping an English Muffin in the toaster. Maybe it would've been nice to have a newspaper in the lobby in the morning - but there was a guy right outside on the corner selling them. But what about when there's inclement weather? Still, it's a cool place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Baltimore location, outdated interior”
Reviews.Author: natalka523
Reviews.Content: Checking-in was fast, easy, and the attendant was very friendly. Rented a loft that looked very different from the photos on the hotel's website. I expected a much more modern looking room. The decor is circa 1983, the carpets are sticky, furniture is hard, worn and torn. The televisions (not flat panels) show very staticky cable, almost to the point of being unwatchable. Found bottles and bottle caps under and behind furniture and ac blower. The room never got cold even though I had the AC on the coldest settings for 48 hours. And I can't explain the reason, but I had a migraine from the time I walked into the room until I checked-out. Atleast there were NO bedbugs, for which Baltimore is notorious. Saw only one lonely little spider.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,wonderful and very helpful staff,great breakfast,lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judy0810
Reviews.Content: Free shuttle very close to hotel. My first time going to Baltimore. I can hardly wait to go back. I will stay longer next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, lovely rooms, convenient location, tasty breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: jonnielime
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights (a Wednesday and Thursday) with my husband and our three 20-something kids and were very pleased. My first impression was positive. Although small, the lobby has the atmosphere of an intimate, European boutique hotel with a nice seating area to the left and tables and chairs that spill out from the cafeteria on the right. When we arrived, at about 7:00 p.m., there was one clerk behind the counter helping a customer and a woman in line ahead of me. Another woman stood off to the side, looking as though she was waiting for someone, and when I walked up she asked me if I was checking in. When I said yes, she said, "Then let me help get everyone registered." Turns out she was the manager, and although she was ready to leave for the day, she returned to the counter to expedite our registration. That is the kind of customer service you rarely see these days, and I was very impressed. Charm City, indeed. Registration was speedy (I had a reservation) and I was further impressed with the parking facilities, which had an elevator that led right up to the lobby as well as to the hotel floors. The front desk staff provided a card to place on your dashboard, which also included clear and explicit directions to the garage. It is attached to the hotel, but because of all the one-way streets in Baltimore, it takes a couple of turns to access it. It is small -- which I actually liked, since it meant less walking and quicker departures -- but I can see that, from what another reviewer said who was not able to secure a spot, its size could be problematic. I didn't price any other parking facilities, but I thought that $15 a day was very reasonable for a city hotel. Service continued to be efficient: at registration, the clerk made a call to housekeeping to bring extra towels and a rollaway to our room; by the time I had parked the car and made my way upstairs (no more than 10-15 minutes, tops), the addtional towels were in the bathroom and my son was happily ensconced on the extra bed. Towels were good sized and nice and fluffy, too -- not the thin, skimpy things you sometimes find at hotels. Our room was also to our satisfaction. The decor was very updated and had a high end feel: very nice desk and chair, TV armoire, 2 upholstered chairs with small side table, brass lamps. Not the Four Seasons, of course, but definitely at least equal to most good quality hotel chains. We all agreed, however, that the desk area definitely needed more lighting. Room was not huge, but even with 5 adults and the rollaway we never felt cramped. Bathroom was very clean with a marble vanity that gave it a touch of elegance. My only complaint is that I found the beds too hard, and the rollaway too thin and soft, but I am very picky about my mattress; it is a problem I have at many hotels. The central location of the hotel was also great. It was a short ride to Lexington Market in one direction (we could even have walked it, but had later destinations that required a car, so we drove the few blocks) and to Antiques Row in the other. My husband and sons caught the Light Rail a few blocks over to catch a game at Camden Yards, which worked beautifully. The hotel is virtually across the street from the Walters Art Museum, and Harborplace is also just down the road. I was really surprised by some of the other reviewers' comments that the area is not safe. I did not have that impression at all. Although it is certainly not in an exclusive neighborhood by any means, it seemed fine to me; pretty much what I would expect to find in a large downtown area. We thought the breakfast was also good. Each guest is given a ticket for one hot meal per day of stay, served to you in cafeteria style. Each day of our stay it included ordinary but well-cooked scrambled eggs, bacon, and sausage, as well as some really excellent potatoes. One day it also included french toast, and the other pancakes, which we found to be just OK. Next time I would probably skip those and just ask for more potoates -- yum! Also available -- and not limited by a ticket -- were bagels, english muffins, toast, cold cereal, and packages of instant oatmeal and grits. Peanut butter, assorted jellies, and cream cheese were provided and, contrary to the experience of one reviewer, so were cups of yogurt and canned and frest fruit. I was also very pleased by the choice of juice that was offered -- orange, grape, cranberry, apple and (my favorite!) grapefruit. We did not eat in the cafeteria for any other meals (except that my son purchased a beer one night, which was nice to have available), but the prices I saw seemed very reasonable. All in all, a happy stay and a place I would definitely visit again. The young man from the American Visionary Art Museum (our first stop in Baltimore and a really cool place) who gave us directions said his parents stay there every time they come to see him. I can understand why.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was decent, but in a shady area of town!”
Reviews.Author: peekaboo_iseeyou
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in order to save a bit of money as the hotels in the Inner Harbor are more money, We both agreed that although the hotel was decent, the area was not! Next time we'd definitely spend a bit more money for the Inner Harbor hotels. We arrived here fairly late and there was NO parking for our car. And the front desk guy could have cared less that we now had to drive around to look for a safe area to park our car. Personally, I think that if you know someone is coming with a car, you should reserve them a spot in the parking garage or make the garage bigger. This area of town is not the safest and we were worried sick about our car bring parked a couple of blocks away with out of State plates. We were not even compensated for our trouble and I think the guy who was at the desk when we checked in genuinely didn't care. The room was really big and it was decent. Although the hotel lobby was beautiful and our overall experience was decent, we'd never stay here again. And I know the general manager comments on all posts by customers and we have zero interest in discussing this further. Thanks anyway though.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay more than $60 for this hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Bill_M_Toronto
Reviews.Content: Fair budget hotel for Baltimore - don't pay more thank $60/night for it on Priceline or similar bidding sites - it's not worth more than that. Good Points: - centrally located in Mt Vernon historic area - great if you want to explore that area - spacious room - king size bed with firm mattress - quiet hotel Bad Points: - we arrived at 11 pm and wanted to use bathtub but it was plugged up and did not drain - no plumber available until next morning at 9 am - breakfast is pretty sad - carbonized sausages, not enough coffee, no fruits or yogourt - no healthy food at all - no amenities - forget about a pool, business centre etc - this is a basic hotel with room only If you're looking for something beyond basic, stay away from the Mt Vernon and check out the name brand hotels near the Inner Harbour

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: Joshgator
Reviews.Content: Arrived and departed by light rail, 5-10 min walk to the hotel. Stayed six nights. Rooms are what I call standard, everything seemed clean, and in working order. Breakfast was a pleasant surprise, cafeteria quality hot meal of eggs, bacon, sausage, home fries and either french toast or pancakes - plus the expected cereals, bagels, muffins, etc. Its a 15min walk to the harbor/camden yards, and even closer to lexington market. The Basilica, and Walters Art Museum are literally across the street. Free wi-fi was hassle free, and they held my bags until my evening flight. Plenty of restaurant options within a few minutes walk. Front desk staff was always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good, basic hotel with off-street parking”
Reviews.Author: agent1974
Reviews.Content: The room had a safe, a TV, an iron, and an ironing board. That's it for amenities, but that's all I needed. I got a great rate and the bed was comfortable. I paid $15/day for the underground parking garage, which seemed reasonable. Can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Andit519
Reviews.Content: As has been said in the past, you get what you pay for!!! This hotel is great for being close to the Inner Harbor, especially if you use the FREE Charm City Circulator busses. However, the rooms are very plain and furniture is sparse, especially in the bathroom. The bathroom is very large but there is nowhere to even sit your clothing for after you dry off. My other major complaint is that housekeeping is stingy with supplies. I had to go to the main desk to get another roll of toilet paper and twice had to ask for more towels. The included breakfast was edible but nothing special. We parked across the street in the parking garage and saved a boatload of money. The place isn't terrible, but also isn't anything spectacular either. But, for the price, you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “one of the the greatest hotel in baltimore”
Reviews.Author: DFD476
Reviews.Content: myself and my gf stayed here for a convention and from the momument we checked in to the day we checked out the staff especially Andy(Front Desk Manager) and Jerome at the front desk were absoultely great we arrived our room wasnt ready Andy offered to hold our bags for us until the room was ready and told us he would call when the room was ready sure enough he did and the day were set to leave our train wasnt until 9:30 at night and Andy was kind enough to hold our bags for us until we were ready to head to train station

Reviews.Title: “Staff is courteous, but not very knowledgable”
Reviews.Author: crysdunn
Reviews.Content: A friend and I decided to have a girl's weekend away. We chose the Mount Vernon Hotel for it's affordability and reasonable proximity to Baltimore's Inn Harbor and other attractions. Not being familiar with the area, and also wanted to do more relaxing than site seeing, we chose two excursions; The National Aquarium and a visit to Edgar Allan Poe's grave at the Westminster. We were told by the concierge that the Aquarium was with in walking distance -- this walk was the equivalent of a marathon. Walking in the blazing heat uphill is not what I would consider "reasonable" as they were unable to give us specific directions. We also inquired at the front desk as to the location of EA Poe's grave. The gentleman on duty was unsure but offered to do a google search and print walking directions, stating that it would take no more than 6 minutes. Our 6 minute walk turned into nearly 90 minutes and we ended up at a police station no where near the cemetery. This directional failure then forced us to spend $40 on a cab ride to back track the entire route. In addition to a blatant lack of information, the hotel was not equipped with basic essentials such as glasses (not plastic cups), or real utensils (again, not plastic). We inquired as to where such items could be purchased and the suggestions were slim. Despite the aforementioned issues, the staff was very friendly and quite adept at uncorking wine bottles. Staff aside, since the heat was near volcanic temperatures during our stay, the garbage at the hotel was beginning to noticeably fester, leaving a pungent odor in the loby and elevators. The facility itself, however, was clean. The rooms were also clean and very well maintained. There is no room service in this hotel, parking is $15 per day and the "restaurant" is more of miniature cafeteria. I would not recommend eating here despite the offer of a free breakfast. You would be better off visiting the cafe in the Public Library across the street. Surprisingly enough, even though our trip has some problems, if you're on a budget I would still recommend staying here... just make sure you have all the directions you need to any attraction you're interested in. And the number of a good cab company!

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be updated”
Reviews.Author: akadvm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not terrible, but certainly not one I'd like to stay at again. There is no fitness center; the restaurant is really just a cafeteria (complete with a serving line and food scooped on to your plate); the amenities in the rooms are outdated; the comforters are polyester and the pillows are thin; the parking garage has limited spaces and is so tight I was afraid I would not be able to get my SUV parked. My air conditioner didn't work so I had to change rooms because all the maintenance had "left for the day" and there was only one person on duty at the desk so I had to come downstairs and get what I need to move rooms (it was only 8pm!). The only plus was free Wifi in the rooms. Basically this hotel is good for sleeping and that's it. Don't expect anything fancy or luxurious by any means. My job booked the hotel for me, but I am going to recommend they not send anyone else here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Vacationista7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easy to get to from the airport. It was only a lightrail ride, and the stop was 4 blocks from the hotel. We were looking for a hotel within walking distance to the Mt. Vernon neighborhood, and this was perfect. The front desk staff were extremely friendly. We got there before check-in time, but we were able to check our bags so we could explore. The staff member remembered us when we came back in the late afternoon. Our room was very nice and cool (especially nice because Baltimore was in a heat wave). Everything was clean and average. The elevators were a little slow, and seeing we were only on the second floor we often chose to walk up the stairs. There was a free breakfast, which was filling (eggs, bacon, hashbrowns) but was little lacking on fruit. At the end of our stay, we had appointments in the late afternoon, and we were able to check out but keep our bags safely in the back room of the front desk. I would definitely recommend staying here. It wasn't a luxury hotel, but I felt the price was good for the place, and it met our needs for location when we were visiting Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: theleftway
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the MVH. I was a little nervous to stay there because the reviews were very mixed. However, my stay there was great! The location is wonderful -- very close to many parts of the city. However, just like all parts of Baltimore, there are some seedy sections about 2 blocks away. The breakfast was GREAT! I was really surprised too! I had a nice hot breakfast every morning. Parking is a little annoying. We parked on the street one day and I was towed ($275!!), but it was my first time in Bmore, and I didn't understand the parking signs. After talking to the front desk, I parked across the stree for $10 (but each time you leave you have to pay, which the front desk didn't tell me). We also parked 1 1/2 blocks away, which was a $6 parking lot for 24 hours. So, parking turned out fine. The rooms are really nice. However, to have a microwave, it's an extra $10/day. I thought that was crazy! But, there is free internet, which was great. Also, the hotel desk guy with the braids is really, really nice!! Overall, I'd recommend people to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel.......hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: valeriecolleen
Reviews.Content: I am always nervous to stay in hotels that I have never heard of. I read the reviews on trip advisor and they were mixed. I went to Baltimore with 2 girlfriends to go to the Oriels games and night life. The hotel was convenient to shopping and eating. We were able to walk to the baseball game and inner harbor. It wasn’t as close as some of the name brand hotels. The inside was nice and the rooms were spacious. The room rate includes breakfast and it wasn’t just continental. They had a hot section which included bacon, eggs, potatoes, French toast, and eggs. They also had cereal, sodas, coffee, bagels, and muffins. Overall, we would definitely go back. The staff was friendly and you couldn’t beat the price for being in the city of Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “You Will Be Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: MizzM500
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled June 11-13 for a wedding in Baltimore from Pittsburgh. We were going to stay in a hotel at the Inner Harbor but chose not to at the last minute. After reading the positive reviews ( I read them all both good and bad) and some good natured teasing about our sports teams.... GOOOO STEELERS.....I decided to book at the Mount Vernon...with my husband and two children...and we are glad that we did. The staff was excellent...Jerome and Carl were very helpful as well as the rest of the staff. We went to the Rusty Scupper but my husband was not pleased and the following night Carl recommended a WONDERFUL seafood restaurant name Moe's...he even had them come pick us up and bring us back....the food was EXCELLENT and well worth the money. THANKS CARL.....The hotel garage was full so we had to park in the garage across the street...which was no big deal....and we felt safe. The breakfast was good and getting to the Harbor was easy.....We would have no problem stay ing there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mt. Vernon”
Reviews.Author: B-Travlin
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was a little hard to find and didn't realize it had an underground parking garage until we'd already arrived and had tried to find a parking place while checking in. The hotel was in a great location with lots of restaurants and a mall not far and within walking distance. The Harbor and National Acquarium were within walking distance as well. We loved our time in Baltimore and the Mt. Vernon Hotel was a great addition to our visit. The room was clean and the staff was outstanding. The free breakfast wasn't great, but it was okay. But give me a clean room over a great breakfast anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price I paid”
Reviews.Author: Iluvtravel007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty good for the price i paid (100per night). My stay was pretty comfortable though I wish I had a room looking out the street whether then the one with the inner view. I cannot tell the difference between day and night. However, the area is good, it is within walking distance to most sights. Pro: The internet connections is VERY fast. The area is close to a lot of good restaurants and the inner harbor. The location is also the safest in the area. Con: The breakfast left something to be desire. I am not an early raiser. When I get to the breakfast at 9am (which serve from 6-10), all the hot food (eggs, bacon, hash browns) are already cold. I stayed for 4 nights and for 2 of the nights I was asked for changes from some weird people standing right outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMom1990
Reviews.Content: Much more personality than a large chain....both the building and the staff. Very convenient to the Basillica.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Mount Vernon Hotel, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: brownsherie
Reviews.Content: We visited Baltimore for our son's graduation and wanted a different place to stay than our typical haunts way outside of town along the highway. We've made at least 15 visits in the last four years so have plenty of hotels to compare. Because our visit fell on the same weekend as the Preakness, we knew things were going to fill up fast. Seeing the positive reviews here, I decided to book Mount Vernon Hotel because of location, price and because it included Wi-Fi and breakfast. Most of that turned out to be true. The hotel is very beautiful, the rooms clean and the staff exceedingly helpful. But due to their being completely booked, we had some issues. This hotel used to be a YMCA and the rooms are not uniform, so I should have thought to ask for a room with a window--I've never thought of not having one and how claustrophobic it would feel. So, Night #1 in the first room: low ceiling, no window, no closet (not even a coat hook for our dress clothes) no working WiFi, broken coffee pot and a telephone that kept inexplicably buzzing (as if the phone was off the hook) until we pulled its plug. The lamps, etc. were sort of second-hand shop. We also paid for the hotel parking lot that night, but pulled our car into the garage to find that they have about 15 spaces for the entire hotel, and they were all taken. We had to pay for another lot across the street. The desk clerk took the charge off the room. (We aren't complainers, we just didn't want to pay for parking that didn't exist.) In the morning, I asked if we could be moved to another room if one became available because my husband was really claustrophobic. Since it was now Sunday night, they did have enough checkouts and we could move. They had us call later in the day and had new room keys for us when we returned to the hotel that night. Night #2 was a completely different situation. The new room had a closet, very nice furnishings, a window (!) and the WiFi signal was strong. The coffee pot even worked! The breakfast was great both mornings, with an actual cafeteria with hot food including french toast, eggs, bacon/sausage and hash browns. Staff was very very nice at every interaction. There is so much to do within walking distance that I would like to stay there again when we have more free time. So, make sure you ask for a room with a window! Even looking at a brick wall and a glimmer of sunlight made a big difference. You won't find a better bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: lon46408
Reviews.Content: Great location for daytime walking around a beautiful Baltimore neighborhood. At night, there's lots of restaurants and places to visit in the neighborhood. Very nice trendy neighborhood. The breakfast was terrific for an inner city hotel. A reasonable walk to the harbor----but a nice walk. Only problem might be parking, but there is a locked garage available to park in. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: btallman06
Reviews.Content: I was recently stranded in Baltimore for a week due to the volcano. I arrived later on a Sunday night, dropped off my bags and went down to the desk in search of places to eat. Not only was there an awesome list (most of which I tried during the week), but Carl recommended a place just down the street and called to let them know I was coming. The great service continued throughout the week. I had to study for an exam and write an essay, so I spent a lot of time in my room where the wifi worked brilliantly. The location is great, in between the Inner Harbor and, what I would call, the theater district with lots of cafe and cute restaurants. The staff was extremely accommodating when my flight ended up being later in the evening and made arrangements for transportation to the airport. I whole-heartedly recommend the Mount Vernon Hotel. The breakfast is good, the location is great, and the staff is fantastic. No frills, but who needs frills when you're in the middle of everything!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: 93happycamper
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully restored hotel. The rooms are clean and tastefully decorated. The lobby is comfortable and the breakfast is quite substantial. The best part was the hotel staff. Carl at the front desk was extremely helpful. There were no spaces in the garage for our car. He came down and moved his car so we could park. He called our restaurant to arrange for a ride and called again when the shuttle took longer than expected. He shared great insights about the attractions in the area. He is a great asset to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly atmosphere and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: chicnhair
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mt Vernon Hotel for 6 days in April of 2010. The staff was friendly, honest and accommodating of my schedule. They assisted me when needed with directions and attractions. I liked the close proximity to Baltimore's ethnic restaurants and locally-owned shops as well as the Walters Art Museum, Contemporary Museum and the History Museum. Although the wireless signal was sometimes not available in the room, it was always available for FREE in the lobby. The free breakfast was a great time to meet with other colleagues staying at the hotel and spend some time in a home-like atmosphere. Really enjoyed my stay!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value”
Reviews.Author: RoscoLyons
Reviews.Content: All in all a very good value--through Hotwire I got a $57 rate. The hotel is in an historic building, but the rooms have been fairly recently renovated--clean and spacious. If you're up to a 10-15 minute walk to Inner Harbor attractions, you'll find the location to be fine. The neighborhood is deserted at night, but not intrinsically unsafe. Staff are very helpful and courteous. Comes with a hearty breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff. Good room but lobby needs work. Location looks unsafe at night”
Reviews.Author: Andre
Reviews.Content: The photos are somewhat reflective of what the hotel is - rooms are nice with good decor. However, when I checked in at the lobby, perhaps because of the cheap fluorescent lighting, the lobby gave me a rundown motel 8 feel. During daytime, it looked better the reality is probably somewhere in between. The night-hour staff who checked us in was very friendly. I am not familiar with the Baltimore downtown area that is not near the inner harbor, but at night, the area doesn't look completely safe. We opted to pay $14 to park our car in the secured basement of the hotel. Internet is free but is close to unusable in terms of speed. The rate is pretty good so I would still consider it a good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoingGoingSwVa
Reviews.Content: This is an exceptional hotel for budget-conscious travelers to Baltimore. It is across the street from a beautifully renovated cathedral (tours for donation), within sight of a large public library (free), and a block from the wonderful Walters Art Museum (free). The neighborhood is great for those who like to walk around and admire old Baltimore architecture (free). Lots of good restaurants nearby, and Walgreens and CVS only about 5 blocks away. We enjoy seeing a city on foot, and walked all the way to the Visionary Art Museum and Harborplace. We had 2 rooms. The rooms were very clean (thank you, housekeeping) and the furnishings modest but very comfortable. There was the usual urban noise at night, but nothing that prevented a good night's sleep. The first floor cafeteria had a good hot breakfast. Other guests included retirees, young adults with backpacks, and at least one family with young children. It was a diverse and comfortable group. All the staff were friendly and gracious. The Mount Vernon is a great choice for economy-minded travelers. It is now my favorite Baltimore hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: guseroni
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we like to stay in unique hotels and it was close to our son's apt. We reserved a king room with the loft as we were also meeting out of town friends and thought we could all come back to our room and visit after dinner. There was a long line at check in which finally another staff memeber helped with . I asked if we had the king loft and he informed me we did and when went to room it had 2 Queens. Went back out to lobby and had to wait in long line again. No problem with changing room but no apology. Now for the biggest disappointment. The " loft" is nothing like the picture on the internet. There was 1 small love seat and a television. We were hoping for ample room for 7 people ( as the internet pictures show) We were late for dinner so did not notify management. We were also told we could park across the street for 4$ a day or in their garage for 14$. When we came back to hotel around 11:30 the garage across the st. was closed and the hotel garage had no spaces. It is very small and difficult to manuever your car. We had to drive back around a few blocks and pull over to go in and inform management. Carl was very pleasant and said that he was leaving and let us have his spot. It took us more than 1/2 hr to finally park the car. It was very cold in our room and just to inform you the heat control is up in the loft which we did not realize until morning. The register by the bed blew cold air which we turned off. I had read good reviews about the breakfast buffet but they must have been short staffed that Sun. Runs from 7-10am. At 9 they were out of bacon and potatoes, "would take 15 min," took 1/2 hr for potatoes. No milk for cereal, people were using coffee creamer. No bread or toast for 1/2 hr and then staff put out 5 bagels. There were probably 30 people present at this time. Very poor Overall very disappointed with experience. We only see our friends one weekend a yr. They come from Wisconsin and our son's apt is too small for all of us to visit in. We spent almost $200.00 to stay there and it definitely was not worth the price. I guess for the 100.00 it would have been sufficient for a regular room but the breakfast would still have been an issue. We come to Baltimore frequently and will not stay there again. On the positive side we did find the Walters Museum and cannot wait to go back there, it is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, good location, not fancy”
Reviews.Author: USA_Super_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location and a pretty good deal overall. Recently remodeled and lobby and hallways are very bright. Parking is $14 per day, and is in a newly renovated (and very safe feeling) garage in the basement. Room was a decent standard room. Clean and functional, just what you need and nothing more. Free breakfast was so-so, but lots of selection. Front desk staff was very friendly and made us feel welcome. Short walk or taxi ride to Charles St. and Mt. Vernon, great location! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing price with little technicalities”
Reviews.Author: rajwani007
Reviews.Content: At first they let us park for only 14 dollars, which i thought was a good price considering that everywhere else was overpriced. The receptionist was nice and told us all of the attractions and she told us directions to go places we were unfamiliar with. They had an optional safe we could use to keep valuable items. The room overall was nice, just that the bed was creaking a little and made some noise but that wasn't much of a problem. We had a room next to the elevator so we could here the dings and dongs as the the elevator opened and closed. Breakfast is from 7 am to 10 am. The breakfast was not the best at all the eggs were cold, the toast was not well cooked and it was such a small variety of food, but considering it was FREE it was good. Checkout time is 11 but they let us stay till 12. We got to keep our car there for couple more hours even after we checked out. Overall this hotel is nice, its close to all the attractions like inner harbor, well priced considering we reserved our hotel the day before, I slept very well, but the breakfast was alright.

Reviews.Title: “a great value and location”
Reviews.Author: GeorgisWallingfordPA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a find! Newly restored in 2009. This was originally a YMCA built in 1907. The renovation is beautiful and took great care in preserving some of the orignal features in the old building. Rooms are a nice size and clean. Front desk staff were all very courteous and helpful with directions, tickets, etc. You can buy tickets for the aquarium in advance and they are discounted as well. The full breakfast is included in the room price. Food and choices were very basic. The $14/day self parking was much appreciated. Located in a nice neighborhood close to museums and Basilica. We walked to the inner harbor in about 20 minutes (about 10 blocks downhill. Uphill on the way back!). Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “You can NOT find a better hotel for this price and location.”
Reviews.Author: hoppa1177
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 2 kids. I was happy to find such great reviews by other people who had stayed. We were able to walk to the harbor (however with children is difficult). The staff was amazing. Carl the desk manager was such a great help. The hotel has such charm to it. The rooms were roomy and very comfortable. We were so glad to have a hot buffet breakfast to help cut costs on eating out. We will continue to stay here time and time again. In fact we are planning a trip again soon. Only downfall is parking overnight is expensive here. Would recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: Monserrata
Reviews.Content: Having grown up in New York City, I am very familiar with some of the finest hotels in the country in addition to having worked for a private hotel in NY that caters to UN Diplomats, I have a very discriminating palate when it comes to hotels. "You get what you pay for" often applies to hotels, NOT IN THIS CASE!!!!!..............You get much much more than you are paying for in terms of the level of hospitality, room and location. I would recommend this hotel to one and all, and plan to make it my home away from home when in Baltimore!!

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain for the location and nice buffet breakfast included!”
Reviews.Author: NancyBuffalo_NY
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel to be near the Peabody Conservatory where my son was auditioning. Very convenient to the conservatory by the way. The room price included a nice buffet breakfast which was great! It was nice not to have to find a place for a quick breakfast OR pay for an exensive hotel breakfast. The Front Desk staff was very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: mimays2
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for New Years Eve & Day with my husband & friends. It was not only a great price of $99/night but it was very tidy & the front desk personnel were great as well. They were always very helpful. The rooms were extremely presentable, clean & comfortable. I'd definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: RLee3
Reviews.Content: The Mount Vernon is in a pretty good location in downtown. It's within walking distance to the inner harbor, Federal Hill and Camden Yards although it's a trek. The rooms are huge. There are students living in the hotel but they're quite and respectful. We had no issues with them. The garage is a nice benefit. The breakfast is amazing with a ton of options. The staff was pretty helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not the nicest hotel, but great service and nice little touches”
Reviews.Author: tux259
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a Friday night in order to take my LSAT on Saturday morning at the nearby university. It was a great experience. I was warmly greeted every time I came into the hotel by the receptionist (who used my first name) and they had no problem taking my luggage for an extra few hours after my check out. I rode my motorcycle there, and the receptionist, who was a motorcycle guy, was more than happy to let me park in the garage for no charge. I also got a call a bit after I checked in to check up on me and see if there was anything that could be done to make my stay more comfortable. The rooms themselves were average. No cool TV services or anything, but there is WiFi. Bathroom and everything else was just fine. Overall, I enjoyed my cheap stay in Baltimore here. It's no luxury hotel, but it was perfect for a college student.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, old-fashioned hotel - great value in good, center-city location.”
Reviews.Author: FrugalSophisticate
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel I read earlier reviews with trepidation. But my stay was an entirely pleasant experience. Very cordial and helpful check-in; clean, comfortable and updated room; safe and secure parking underneath (key card garage with metal door, an easy elevator ride to lobby or room); and full, cooked breakfast buffet. The lobby is quite basic, with formica counter possibly left from when this building was the Baltimore Y, but rooms, hallways etcetera seemed comparable to any good quality, mid-level hotel, and the breakfast room is pleasant - all for a bargain basement rate. Short walk to Monument Square, Walters Art Gallery, Peabody Institute, Basilica and Mount Vernon restaurants - easy 10 min drive up Charles Street to Johns Hopkins or the other way for Inner Harbor, Fell's Point etcetera. Parking is extra - still a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Great value - will return”
Reviews.Author: bnssr
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by Carl when we arrived. Talk about GREAT customer service! Not only was he helpful & friendly but was also a refreshing voice after an 8 hour drive. He even gave us tips on parking (park in the garage across the street). Did not have a problems w/ bedbugs. All the staff were friendly, nice, courteous, & helpful. If you will be out at night know where you're going! If standing in front of the hotel w/ your back to the front door, going to the right (after dark) would be questionable. Any other direction you're ok.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, no frills”
Reviews.Author: zooeyG
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Mount Vernon Hotel for almost a week at the end of August, beginning of September while waiting to move into my apartment. The location is very good, Mount Vernon is close, the Inner harbor is not far either. Rooms are okay, but I did get bitten by bedbugs in the first room. I reported it to one of the ladies at the front desk but I guess she just couldn!t bother to do anything. After my second request (by then I had bites all over) I got another room. This, of course, pretty much cast a shadow on my stay there, especially that I had to clean and laundry everything I had with me so that I don!t carry bugs with me back home. Otherwise the hotel is okay, staff was overall very nice and helpful, except for that one young lady. Carl is a real gem, great sense of humor, very very helpful. Breakfast was nice variety. I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Chizhik55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mount Vernon only one night and were very impressed by the service there. Everyone was super nice and went out of their way to help us with whatever request we had. Mount Vernon has the friendliest staff out of all the hotels I have ever stayed in. The hotel is very nice and affordable for the location. The room was comfortable, clean, and had all we needed, including wifi. A good variety for breakfast, which is complimentary. We will definitely definitely stay at Mount Vernon again!

Reviews.Title: “Good price for a decent, no-frills place”
Reviews.Author: MarkWing
Reviews.Content: My son and I were visiting the Peadbody Institute, and this hotel has a special rate for Peabody guests, which was a fantastic rate for the area. It is a close walk from here to the Peabody, which was great. The room was large and rather plain, but clean and decent. No frills. Having read the many complaints on Trip Advisor about air conditioning, we were suspicious but discovered you simply have to turn the thermostat all the way down, and then it seems to work OK. The free breakfast is extensive and better than most other hotels. Location is only a few blocks from a light rail stop, and the walk to the harbor isn't bad if you're accustomed to walking.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but no AC in our room”
Reviews.Author: palovestotravel123
Reviews.Content: It was a bit of a walk to the harbor, but not too bad. Don't stay in room 317 if you want air conditioning, but there was a fan waiting in the room for us. This tells me that they have already had complaints about this. The room is large and clean. The breakfast was cold both days that we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Inner Harbour hotel”
Reviews.Author: jalu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mount Vernon hotel in June as part of a combined tour of Washington and Baltimore and rated it highly. The hotel is on a hill close to the Inner Harbour and has a car park below it, although the instructions given to us by reception didn't make the location immediately clear. The rooms were decorated with dark wood which took a bit of getting used to however were always clean, tidy and welcoming. The hotel included free breakfast with the room, however the food didn't look massively appealing and we only ate there a couple of times during our stay. The staff were always polite and friendly with lots of printed information available in the foyer. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: phillips85
Reviews.Content: Stayed a night at the Mt Vernon Hotel on a whim, found the service to be impeccable (Carl behind the desk had an easy, appealing sense of humor and took good care of our reservation!) and the location to be perfect. The room was clean, comfortable, and affordable. We'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “this is the place to be to enjoy downtown Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Ippex
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to attend an event at the conference center in Baltimore at the last minute and I had a hard time finding a place to stay with a decent room rate in a pleasantly safe area. Thank goodness I found the Mount Vernon. I knew it was the right choice the moment I walked in the door to see the beautiful lobby and the extremely friendly staff. Check in was a breeze and our room was nicely appointed, the bathroom lovely and the whole think was clean as a whistle. The complimentary breakfast was hot and plentiful and the breakfast room is charming and whimsically decorated. It is a short walk to the inner harbor and the conference and to other areas of interest. The neighborhood looks to be on an upswing and there were plenty of interesting restaurants and shopping in the immediate area. We are definitely going to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL NIGHT”
Reviews.Author: deninfred
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Room was clean and comfortable. Front desk staff helpful. Only 2 small concerns, first no place to park to check in and second the garage in bottom of building was very small to get around in. I have a full size extended cab pickup and one corner to get around I only had about 1 inch on each side of vehicle and that was by pulling and backing up several times. SO DO NOT BRING A BIG VEHICLE!!!! Although garage was very secure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, resonably priced”
Reviews.Author: cphawkes
Reviews.Content: Cheaper than neighbouring hotels and within walking distance of the pier / conference centre. Clean and friendly hotel, I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place”
Reviews.Author: Peabodyparents
Reviews.Content: This hotel has become our home away from home when we visit Baltimore (which we do often, as our daughter attends the nearby Peabody Conservatory). Even though we have relatives with whom we could stay, we choose to stay here because it is close to the Inner Harbour and cultural sites. The renovations are beautiful, the rooms are clean, and the free breakfast alone makes the stay worthwhile. However, the best thing about this hotel is its manager (Carl Smith) and his wonderful staff. They are the definition of hospitality, warmth and efficiency. They really go above and beyond expectations. For us, it is always a 5-star experience!

Reviews.Title: “Obama Inaugural Base”
Reviews.Author: Koolit
Reviews.Content: Good intercity hotel. This property would normally be reasonably priced except that I booked late to attend the Obama inauguration, so the price was abnormally high. Rooms are sad and not well kept, but the staff was very friendly and tried hard to accommodate. However, the included breakfast was excellent , because the cafe downstairs pride itself in fixin up a great hearty full breakfast - a lot local non-guest ate there each morning my son and I were there.

Reviews.Title: “Minimal frills, but great service and very clean! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Dvm2k1
Reviews.Content: Not fancy, but highly recommended for the great service and reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again, great value”
Reviews.Author: carolrn65
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be clean, comfortable and the front desk staff very helpful. The hot breakfast included was an unexpected plus!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: SmokeysMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here March 19th, 2009 for a concert. While he waited in the car I went and checked in. You can park at the entrance temporarily (you'll need to in order to check in and then get a pass to the parking garage) but he stayed there just in case there was an issue. The hotel is four blocks from the First Mariner Arena, and not in a very good looking neighborhood (my husband was approached by someone wanting a ride). The hotel lobby is very clean and the receptionist was prompt and polite. She gave coupons for breakfast and a paper on how to get to the parking garage. You have to go around the block to get to the parking garage, and then since it is closed, you need to "honk horn once for entry". In our case it was more like five times, with perhaps 1 minute intervals between honks (the receptionist can hear the honking and presses a button to open the garage). The parking garage is a very very small, very very compact, with not a lot of spaces. I have a Subaru Forester and I do not want to ever go back there with a car that size. A compact car would be "ok" in this garage, as its a very very tight squeeze. I found a good parking spot (which wasn't very good when it came time to leave). The only thing good about the garage is it is enclosed and somewhat secure. Our room was very clean, though no refrigerator or microwave. They had extra pillows in the drawers. My only con against the rooms is that there are a few channels, and the TV Power button was broken (the power button on the remote worked fine). The hotel has a very good buffet. The food was excellent and the area was clean. For lunch I had beef and a roll. The beef was very tender and made my mouth water. For dinner I had the chicken and noodles, and that too was very good. Checking out was a breeze, however leaving the parking garage was a pain that I would rather not go through again. With the tight fit of the Forester, I had no more than an inch to spare on each side pulling out of a very tight parking spot. I enlisted the help of my husband and a very helpful employee to get out of my parking spot. I had another tight spot I had to maneuver around (we didn't leave the hotel to sight see like we wanted to mainly because of the parking garage, and the area did not look too "safe" to walk around in) and then I got to the garage door. It automatically opens so no wait for the receptionist to hear our honking. Overall, I LOVE the hotel. I absolutely hate the parking garage, so if you either have a compact car, have someone else driving, or take a cab, you should be ok. As I said, the area itself doesn't look too safe, so I wouldn't recommend it for the solo traveler. I would rate this five stars if they had more channels, a fridge, and a better parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “dirty and awful”
Reviews.Author: johgoodrich
Reviews.Content: Smoke free room? Our phone had been used as an ashtray (not cleaned out). It was January, and we had no heat for the extent of our stay, even after complaining. Cable had, perhaps, 6 channels. Windows filthy, could not see out of them. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “locks and lighting”
Reviews.Author: ShaunaofSCA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mt. Vernon Hotel for one night the day after Christmas. I'd selected it for it's proximity to the Walters Art Museum, which is one block over from it. I called directly to place my reservation and asked for a smoke free room. I was pleased to be told the entire facility is smoke free. The directions to get there from rte 83 were simple. On arrival, I was given simple instructions to drive around the block to the parking garage in the basement. The parking garage area is unstaffed, and therefore a safety concern to a woman traveling alone. It is well lit, reasonably clean, and odor free. On check in, the assistant manager working the desk was friendly and personable, I was given a keycard and voucher for breakfast in the cafeteria and a tourist map of Baltimore. I went up to my assigned room and found it to be quite cold in the room. The heating controls were prominently located and simple to operate and when turned on let out a strong blast of hot air. The room lights were quite dim (60 watt bulbs in dark shades). Even with all four room lightsources on I would not have been comfortable reading in that inadequate light. My mother, who has poorer vision than I do and who fortunately was not with me, would have found the dim lighting an unacceptable handicap. While messing with the lights I determined why the room was so cold with the heat blower off. It's an old building with marble slab windowsills -- formal and elegant and cold as ice to touch. I don't envy them their heating bills trying to overcome a building full of such heatsink windowsills. I left the room to go see the Washington Monument (about two blocks away) and as I exited, I automaticly reached back to be sure the door had locked. It had not locked, and I spent the next 5 minutes trying to get it to lock without success. I went down to speak with the assistant manager at the check in desk. He was horrified, and immediately swiched my room to another on the same floor. While he and I were speaking, I observed some college age young men enter with a case of beer and get on the elevator. I commented that it looked like there would be a party tonite. The assistant manager who had just told me he was moving me to 305 noted my comment and handed me a keycard for 318, saying 305 would be too close to the party. I never heard any party noise at all. 318 was just as dimly lit and just as cold on entry as my original room, but 318's heat blower was also quite strong and the room reached a comfortable temperature quickly. All carpeting appeared brand new both in rooms and in halls. Bedding, bathroom and elevator were all clean. The shower controls required experimentation to master, but there was lots of hot water with excellent water pressure and showerheads that adjusted to power stream if wanted. The choice of TV channels were minimal (about 20) and the weather channel was via sattelite and therefore did not have local weather which was annoying. I arrived for breakfast at the cafeteria just before it closed (10am) so no bacon, lumpy farina and a dry biscut were predictable, and good scrambled eggs were an unexpected bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Well run, very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: bustravlr
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room at the Mt Vernon recently because the hotel was close to the Convention Center in Baltimore and had reasonable rates. I stayed for two nights and really enjoyed the stay. The room was very clean and the room and bathroom had been recently upgraded completely. They have a funky little cafeteria adjoining the hotel lobby that serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner. It's not an "order from menu" type of restaurant but they had two hot entrees and vegies, etc for the lunch and dinner meals. The food was good, "down home" type faire and very reasonably priced. The breakfast was huge - lots of eggs, sausage, bacon, hot cakes, biscuits/gravy. I had my fill! All in all, the hotel is a bargain and the staff was very responsive. And as I mentioned, the hotel is very clean. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else: Cannot be Trusted”
Reviews.Author: MindGuyTraveller
Reviews.Content: First the positives: Clean rooms, excellent renovation, free breakfast. Now the rest: Booked a block of over 20 rooms for a wedding. Management over promised and under delivered. Loft rooms were not with sofa beds as promised. Adjoining rooms were sold to other guests. The groom's room the night before the wedding was sold out to another guest. Rather than sharing his last night before his wedding with his groomsmen in an adjoining room, he ended up at the opposite end of the hotel. Management tried the best they could, but they would rather wash their hands of guilt than act quickly to alleviate problems. If you're coming to Baltimore and the Mount Vernon area, stay at the Peabody Clarion Court Hotel. Yes, the rates may be twice as much as the Mt. Vernon, BUT AT LEAST YOU WILL GET THE ROOM YOU ASKED FOR. PS. Central air, so the system was blowing out heat on a 72 degree day. Nothing like putting on a tux and sweating! Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Price, Clean too”
Reviews.Author: taylor130
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay. The purpose of our visit to Baltimore was to attend a family reunion. Originally we planned to stay in D.C. for a couple of days and then stay at the Mt. Vernon for the night of the reunion. But, since the hotel prices were exorbitant in D.C., we stayed in Baltimore and went in to D.C. for the day. Our room was in a corner on the 2nd floor...very clean and quiet and a decent size. Check in was a breeze and the front desk people were cheerful and helpful. Yes, it is also a dorm for students attending the Baltimore International College; but their rooms seem to be on the top floors (6 upward). The students were courteous and created no problem for us during the 5 nights we were guests. The only negative was the cafeteria for breakfast (which was included). It was more like a soup kitchen, plastic utentils, etc. But, we found a great breakfast cafe, David and Dad's, just one block down on Charles Street. Teo Pepe's is a super resturant, 1/2 block away. It was so good that we had dinner there twice. It is Spanish cuisine. The chef has been there for 28 years, so you can imagine how great that is, knowning how chefs come and go on a regular basis in most resturants. We also enjoyed a local Irish pub, Mike O'Shea's, 1 block down Charles Street (next door to David and Dad's). Not only a friendly local pub, but the food was really good. We had both lunch and dinner, and except for the enormous portions, the food was very good. Next time we go back to Baltimore, we would definitely stay at the Mt. Vernon again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: The-Flying-Circus
Reviews.Content: As of October 2008 this hotel was great! The room we stayed in on the 5th floor was completely renovated. Clean, comfortable, courteous, what more can you ask for. Two queen beds in room with plenty of space left to maneuver around. This place is not 5 star, but its location makes it a super place to base your stay in Baltimore. Light Rail is a few blocks walk, bus lines are all around. Metro subway is only one more block over from Light Rail at Lexington Market. There is some truth to what I've read in other reviews, but the college students were quiet and courteous, the breakfast is cafeteria style but adequate, and the elevator is slow, but that is because it stops at every floor on weekends. Front desk staff was very helpful when I needed assistance. If you can get this place for under $100/night it is more than worth it for the price. Mount Vernon is a very safe neighborhood between Charles and Catherdral. Most places to eat were within 2-5 blocks of the hotel. Be careful at night if you stray more than 3 blocks to west, as that neighborhood is in tough shape. If you don't mind walking you can get to Inner Harbor, Camden Yards, Little Italy, and Fells Point pretty quickly. Most areas that you want to get to are within a 1-3 mile radius. I went with a buddy of mine to visit the historic sites, but plan on bringing my wife and kids to this hotel when I return to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Oddest Hotel in a really strange city”
Reviews.Author: misterfisher2006
Reviews.Content: Oh my gosh! This was just the oddest hotel stay. It seemed more like a college dorm than a hotel, but it was quiet, clean and comfortable, located a quick cab ride to where ever, and at $159 plus tax, one of the best values downtown Baltimore has to offer. At that price, I didn't mind pulling the empty plastic vodka bottle out of the toilet tank when it got lodged under the flapper and the glass pot pipe stashed on the window ledge outside the room seemed simply charming. The continental breakfast was great and well attended by a roster of international tourists, but the restaurant was not open for business, yet, so I don't know how the food will fare on a regular basis. When I arrived a couple hours before check in, they kindly checked my bags and I wandered off to check the local brews and watch the soccer. I'd stay again, if I ever had any reason to be in Baltimore, god save me.

Reviews.Title: “don't overlook Mount Vernon”
Reviews.Author: awrey
Reviews.Content: We'd read some iffy reviews of the Mount Vernon, but all the Inner Harbor hotels were booked. Thank goodness they were! The Mount Vernon recently underwent a renovation--the rooms are comfortable and neat, the staff was ever-smiling and helpful, and the rates were half that of the big hotel chains by the Inner Harbor. I lived in Baltimore many years ago and think the Disneyfication of the Inner Harbor has obscured Baltimore's real charms. The Mount Vernon is in a great location (walking distance of Inner Harbor/Camden Yards/Aquariumm etc.), in heart of Mount Vernon area, close to Lexington Market, Pratt library, etc.) and the building is historic (the old YMCA). Has its own garage. Couldn't have been happier with it.

Reviews.Title: “"Interesting" Lovely staff, well equipped room.”
Reviews.Author: arisun
Reviews.Content: Well, I booked the Mount Vernon to stay for two nights, just my boyfriend and I on our road trip adventure. We started in NYC and finished in Key West, did a LOT in between! We wanted a hotel in Balitmore as our base to see both Washington DC and Baltimore. DC is VERY expensive hotel wise in comparison with B'more and just a short train ride away. We booked the hotel apprehensively after reading some of the reviews here on trip advisor: ceilings falling down, only three legs on beds and so on, we figured it may be an adventure!! Arrived to be greeted by really lovely helpful staff who checked us in quickly and gave us good tips on where to get lunch and how to get to the harbour etc. Very friendly. Got a slow lift up to our hotel room which was (as others have mentioned) on an otherwise rather quiet floor. Opened the room door and were greeted to a fab room, much bigger than (maybe 3 times the size!!) our room in NYC. TV in a huge wooden lush unit, floor lamps, nice new carpet (we've experienced some awful sticky carpet... eww), clean immaculate comfy beds, lovely clean bathroom, we couldnt fault the actual room or the air con etc. We went out for dinner that night to the harbour and came back late to the hotel. Tired and weary from travelling during the day, we were looking forward to a comfy bed. Pressed the lift button (again, took an age to arrive) and waited. Eventually it opened, Im pretty sure my jaw smacked the floor as it did. A burly guy (looked like a minder) walked out with a prostitute in tow (leopard print bra, matching underwear, fishnets, high heel platforms, make up shovelled on, need I continue?) I know Im pretty naiive, and it was a warm night, but is this normal practise to teeter about in such attire? I understand its something that happens, but is it accepted in hotels? So blatent and obvious? This was our main gripe. That and 'grown ups' playing tag in the corridors, running past our room. (I was practically coma-tose I was so knackered, my other half informed me of these extras the next morning!) Also, a drunk guy bouncing off (and slumping against) the corridor walls in what we supposed was an effort to get back to his room after a hard night out. Needless to say I wouldnt recommend it for a family, but if you can look past this it was a fantastic price for a fantastic room in a quiet but central enough part of B'more. I dont know if Id stay here again, im 50:50. My other half thinks he would, for location price and a decent bed it was great. If you can close your eyes to the afforementioned then it would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: japamella
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel six times since Sept. 2007. They were remodeling when we first stayed but had no problems. It is not a great hotel but the staff is friendly and the rooms are clean. We love the location. It is close to Peabody Conservatory of Music (which my nephew attends) and is very close to many attractions. We usually park in the garage across the street and just walk everywhere. The only complaint I have is that this past time we stayed, they no longer offer compliementary breakfast, they now have a small cafe instead. I would also advise to park at the garage across the street since the garage under the hotel is very tight to get through.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from Hell”
Reviews.Author: erbowman
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, check-in was quick and easy. However, we got into the room and it was smelly and muggy. We immediately went to turn the A/C on and, after about 30 minutes, noticed that the air conditioner was not blowing cool air out. This was our first contact to the front desk. They apologized and told us that they don't have the air on for the season yet. Let me express to you how HOT it was in this room, and my situation. It was me and a few girlfriends staying in the room. We were there to hit some of the clubs in the area and have a girls weekend out. So we were going to be getting ready in this hot, sticky room. Anyway, we asked them how they expected us to be able to enjoy ourselves in this room when the windows DON'T OPEN and the air conditioning didn't work. Yes, that's right, the windows were not even created to open. So we had to blow-dry, curl, and take showers in this hot, muggy room. Since the hotel was going through renovations (which was not posted on the website, or mentioned on the phone) the elevators were not working, and the only other option was to take the workers stairs, which were cramped and confusing. There was barely anyone else staying on the floor that we were on, so we left our room door open to let some air in. While I was in the bathroom getting ready, I looked out the door and saw someone hide behind a corner. I looked a little further and noticed that a HOTEL EMPLOYEE was standing in a dark room caddy-cornered from ours watching me get ready! With all that being said, my stay at the hotel was awful. We did however, get our money back. Oh, and by the way, the hotel is also used as college dorms.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: bamt08
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be clean, comfortable, and convenient. It’s in the heart of the Mount Vernon section of Baltimore and many cultural attractions and restaurants are in walking distance. I arrived about 9pm and the hotel parking was full. There is a parking garage across the street, but I chose to park on Charles Street as it was free from 10pm to 8am.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay if you can get the price right”
Reviews.Author: Samatva
Reviews.Content: Ended up at the Mt Vernon after Days Inn Inner Harbor did not honor my reservation. Mt Vernon is a bit older and one elevator was under repair during my stay. My room was nice, but small. The TV channel line up was limited, but surprising has ShowTime included. They do have free WiFi (not secure) which was quite strong and fast in my 5th floor room. The morning continental breakfast was fine - the restaurant was closed (renovation?). The neighborhood is "interesting" - I walked through a few questionable blocks (boarded up businesses, etc), but never felt threatened. I was able to get the same price for nights 2 and 3 that Days Inn paid for my first night - $99 vs. $155 normal or $122 govt employee. They were not booked full even though a national extreme sports competition was in town... My guess is that you could negotiate a good deal on a room - if so, it's a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: killgore
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Mount Vernon Hotel was excellent! Although it is about a 12-15 minute walk to the harbor and convention center, the hotel was by far the best value I could find in the area. It is an older building, but that gives it a lot of charm and interest. It is beautifully decorated in the main entrance and there is a great contenental breakfast in the morning (waffles, cereal, bagels, yogurt, fresh fruit, etc.) in a separate dining room with lots of decorations and flurishes. My room was complete with a great King size bed, beautiful solid wood furniture, decent size TV, new carpet, and a newly renovated, clean, and nicely adorned bathroom. My wife loved the lighting and mirror in the bathroom and said she would stay again just for the bathroom, if nothing else. The room had the usual freebies of shampoo, conditioner, etc. and had a hair dryer, iron, and ironing board. There was free wireless internet too. We stayed in the first week of June and it was scorching hot outside, but our room was comfortable and the air-conditioning was perfect. Cleanliness is very important to me in a hotel, and the Mount Vernon was one of the cleaner hotels I have stayed at in a while. The staff at the desk was helpful and always in good cheer. Probably my biggest complaint was that there was only one elevator working at the time I was there, which made things slow at times. Often I took the stairs to the 6th floor, rather than wait. However, in fairness, there was a construction crew fixing the elevator the day I checked out, so this might not be a permanent problem. There is parking available in a garage below the hotel and there is a small fee for that. The hotel is not too far from some nice little shops and restaurants in the area and a cab ride to the harbor is less than $5. Overall, if you like the charm of early 20th century architecture and are not looking for the usual Holiday Inn generic hotel, this place can make for a pleasant and memorable stay. We would definitely stay there again if we go back to the Baltimore Harbor area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - clean, attractive room, & good value”
Reviews.Author: buddmar
Reviews.Content: I like staying in the Mount Vernon district of Baltimore, "midtown" about 8 or 9 blocks from the Inner Harbor. The First Cathedral in the US is one block away, the excellant Walters Art Gallery is also just one block away. Within 5 blocks are dozens of great restaurants. The rooms in this hotel are spotlessly clean, super comfortable mattress (but very high off the ground!) and the bathrooms sparkled with classy high polished granite countertops . The room was as good as any 4 star hotel: attractively decorated with cherry wood furniture lots of brass/crystal lamps and the big TV can be hidden in a lovely armoir. My only problem was there were college students who reside on one floor of the hotel, but they were not rowdy ... management should tell them not to loiter in the lobby. I always loved staying at the Peabody Court, two blocks away, but they were asking $179 a night and here I paid only $95. By the way, there is a garage directly across the street that charges $10 for 24 hours, and never closes ... pay no heed to the untruthful and bogus claims that the fee is twice as much or that it is not open 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay every time!!”
Reviews.Author: maniacMaine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed there at least five times when we have come to Balitmore for baseball games. Its location is great ( an easy 25 minutes walk to the stadium), the price is right ( we're hardly in the room, going to museums while not at the ball park or eating at one of the many ethnic restaurants in the Mt Vernon area), and the service is really fine. We like it because it doesn't pretend to be somethng it isn't!! Wallking around the Mt Vernon area is a joy!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Plaruba
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night for a baseball game. It was a good location for a good price. Walking distance to everything, and easy to get to. It was a really safe clean hotel. I wasnt planning on staying in the hotel all day so the minor issues werent really a problem for me. The problems: 1. No dial tone on the phone (who uses them anyway) 2. There were two slow drips from the air conditioner from the celing to the floor once I an while. (I just placed the waistbasket on the floor for one and the ice bucket for the other.) 3. TV reception was poor (some snow and hissing) I wasnt there to watch TV anyway. 4. The toilet tank wouldnt fill up so it wouldnt flush. (I just pored water from the waist basket in the tank so it would flush.) I notified the desk when i arrived. The next day when i left noting was done yet. i.m sure they would take care of it as soon as I left. The business center is closed (being remodeled One of two of the elevators is out. Did I mention it was very very clean. With all the problems I really would stay there again. The hotel being clean and safe was the important issue for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: qualityisjib1
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel. It obviously has gone under some major renovation and it certainly looks it. The staff was helpful and kind. I will stay again. I have found a new homeport in Baltimore. It's called the Mount Vernon Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhh, lacked common sense”
Reviews.Author: Jo-awesome
Reviews.Content: I liked the visit I had to Baltimore, since it was my first the seafood....amazing! The Mount Vernon was missing something though, little things. I could be nit picking but honestly when I stay at a hotel I don't expect to be calling the front desk for things that should have already been in my room. I had to call for a waste paper basket, a tub stopper, more towels after room service came and fixed my bed, an ice bucket. To me and my fiance these items should not have to be asked for. The choice of TV channels were a bit stale aslo. The bed was comfortable, the room was a bit smaller than I'm used to and it had a connecting door which made me nervous lol. The place is still undergoing renovation but I believe they were almost done. I don't think I will stay here again. Jo, the Bronx!

Reviews.Title: “What a change.. Renovated and Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: ConventionGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few months back and enjoyed our visit. But what a difference in this place...and for the BETTER! We noticed signs of renovations upon entering the lobby...new tile, new carpets and furniture too. The desk staff explained that we were going to be in one of the newly renovated rooms and to let us know if we had any suggestions to improve our stay. Anyway, everything was new in our room and beautiful. The hallway on our floor was bright and also newly renovated. We very much enjoyed upgraded rooms and clean feel at this hotel. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Mt. Vernon Hotel - Worst Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Triptaker919
Reviews.Content: I brought my family to Baltimore and wanted to stay at a moderately priced hotel that was close to downtowm. We picked Mt. Vernon because it looked like it had character and charm. We knew it wasn't new, but that's OK. What we didn't expect was the roach problem in our rom that completely spooked my wife and kids. We counted at least six different roaches. When we complained they told us to write a letter to the ownership (which we did and got no response). And using the bathrooms were quite an experience. We had some sewage backup when we arrived and asked for a change of room. They refused that request and instead sent up a third-rate maintenence man. He roto-rootered the prblem out, but it left the room smelling very bad. Later that evening the same problem re-surfaced. Again we complained and asked for a change of rooms and again they refused. I asked to speak with the manager and was told he was busy and to check back in the next day. I asked to make an appointment with him and he laughed and saif that wasn't possible.

Reviews.Title: “terrrible reviews are true”
Reviews.Author: soccermomcamillus
Reviews.Content: We were more or less assigned to this hotel as part of a soccer tournament.... I had read previous negative reviews and hoped they were not accurate. I was wrong! We actually checked in to learn that our "loft" room had no beds in the loft...in fact the sleeping loft was empty. A bedside light had no bulb and when we asked for one, the man who was to bring it asked to check the lamp himself. Carpets were dirty, beds were saggy and the total atmosphere was dismal almost frightening. They had no other room with the correct number of beds that they could offer us...but staying was not what we wanted to do. The only good thing was that we had no problem finding another hotel and the front desk did not hassle us about leaving. Assured us that our credit card would not be charged. We were not the only family who left so perhaps they are used to this.

Reviews.Title: “Batlimore at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Terrychicago
Reviews.Content: My wife and I Stayed at the Mount Vernon many times and the staff always made us feel welcome. The hotel is currently doing some major renovation and so far as made a tremendous effort to upgrade. I talked with the front desk person and was told renovation should be done by spring 2008, New carpets, new bathrooms with granite etc...We will definitly return...It's a great location......

Reviews.Title: “a charm in charm city”
Reviews.Author: traveler816
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel not long ago and had a wonderful time. The staff was very nice and accomodating. The breakfast in the morning was great! My two kids loved making their own waffles in the morning. The room was clean and a great value. We had a great time and will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Who nicked the 'S' from the word "hotel"?”
Reviews.Author: glesgamail
Reviews.Content: What a dive. This place could be a wonderful downtown spot – the ideal location for loads of historic Baltimore – but it's one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in. In the first room we were assigned the shower settings went from "very hot" to "scalding". The utterly useless people at the reception desk gave us another room – the one and only time they actually managed to help solve a problem – but only after I'd seared a layer of dermis off my back. The second room had one thing going for it – size. Jesus, you needed a GPS to get from the bed to the bathroom, but it was musty, dark and retained all the charm of a poorly-appointed prison cell. We endured three nights simply because we were in a wedding party and all the other guests had checked into the place. The rooms were $99 per night – $9.99 would have been too much. As others have noted the Mount Vernon doubles as a student dorm and the front entrance appears to be a prime spot for the students to hang out smoking cigarettes and annoying paying guests. The worst thing about this hotel though is the front desk staff – about as much use as breasts on a frog. They failed on almost every count. By the end of the trip we amused ourselves by having a competition to see who could come up with the simplest request they failed to answer. The winner? What time is it? Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Choice”
Reviews.Author: SugarandSpice1995
Reviews.Content: upon arrival at the hotel, there were about 1000 kids who were hanging around the entrance. come to find out they were students who lived there. i then had the lovely experience of meeting some blonde headed punk kid who was working the desk. where do they get thier employees from? all in all i never had a clean room for my stay. at night i asked for a manager and they told me that he was in the back working at his desk and couldnt tend to me. i have never felt so insulted nor will this hotel go anywhere with this kind of attitude towards its customers.

Reviews.Title: “No sense of hospitality”
Reviews.Author: jermrev
Reviews.Content: Spent a Saturday night with my wife and two kids. Called them a few days ahead because my wife was concerned about the negative reviews. Was assured we would have a good stay. Also asked for a rollaway. Upon arrival, the lobby was filled with exasperated travelers. Check-in time was 2 but rooms were not ready. They could not tell us when they would be ready. We did not get into ours until around 3:30. The room had an odd smell, white powder on the carpet, a used cup with flat orange soda on the windowsill, 2 hand towels and no others, and no rollaway. When I asked about the rollaway at the desk, I was told they were all already allocated, despite my request via telephone. Oh well, got to sleep with my son in a hard bed with sandpaper-like blanket. Found out that their Sunday breakfast ends at 9am. That pissed off a lot of guests, who came to eat as staff was cleaning up causing the staff to call the guests rude because they tried to turn the juice machine back on. On the plus side, they knocked $30 off at checkout without my asking ("Your room smelled bad, right?") - odd, because I never even commented to them about the room's smell. Makes me wonder what was in that room before it was "cleaned".

HotelInfo.Name: Mount Vernon Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 24 West Franklin Street, Baltimore, MD 21201
